items.label: Female Genital Mutilation Data Set
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The [Female Genital Mutilation Data Set](MC|DM|00fe221a-f61e-4102-ad8a-5a0821a11790) provides essential information in relation to the female genital mutilation population across England.

The [Female Genital Mutilation Data Set](MC|DM|00fe221a-f61e-4102-ad8a-5a0821a11790) is used:

  • To publish Official Statistics which will inform the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12), [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d), other Government Agencies and the public, about female genital mutilation when it has been identified
  • To identify the potential risk of female genital mutilation to young girls and vulnerable women
  • For better planning and management of female genital mutilation [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) at a local level and across England

Data may be input immediately using an input screen via the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) Clinical Audit Platform when female genital mutilation is identified, or data extracts for Patients, can be submitted as a bulk upload on a monthly basis for each [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

[CARE CONTACT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|e8728c0e-07e7-4b93-af84-dd0825eb7ce3) activities undertaken for female genital mutilation [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) during the [REPORTING PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|b5f965ea-f3f6-4c01-b6fe-0cb8ef9f063c) are reported in the data upload.  This includes any attendances at an [Out-Patient Clinic](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|def66d62-6198-4724-87b2-951dfbe0d9d2) led by any type of [CARE PROFESSIONAL](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|8d8d3397-4680-4950-a62f-b2bf1dd855a6), [Hospital Provider Spells](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|bd2616d2-18bb-42be-9d18-2b55c2e002b0), [Accident and Emergency Attendances](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4aaac7a4-d792-42af-827d-def398b51345), [Group Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cf7b8cb2-e9b7-41a5-a74e-4f03a705570d), [Ward Attendances](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|90256c5b-32f9-4e86-806e-7e7f8e592cdd); or any other type of direct [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)-facing [CARE CONTACT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|e8728c0e-07e7-4b93-af84-dd0825eb7ce3), with an exception to [Sexual and Reproductive Health Clinics](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|09d80256-37b1-445d-84a2-76476903d8dc) and Genitourinary Medicine (GUM) clinics, who are not required to submit the [Female Genital Mutilation Data Set](MC|DM|00fe221a-f61e-4102-ad8a-5a0821a11790) to the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23).

[SNOMED CT Refset](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|65f065d4-1f34-4d52-8aac-c18844bde150) Metadata:

  • Female genital mutilation related findings:
    • [Refset](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|65f065d4-1f34-4d52-8aac-c18844bde150) FSN: Female genital mutilation related findings simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)
    • [Refset](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|65f065d4-1f34-4d52-8aac-c18844bde150) Id: 999002041000000103

For further details relating to the [SNOMED CT Refset](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|65f065d4-1f34-4d52-8aac-c18844bde150) Metadata, see the [Data Dictionary for Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|92a9a14d-9380-495a-83d4-ed3dbcffa959) ([DD4C](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|92a9a14d-9380-495a-83d4-ed3dbcffa959)) website at: Female genital mutilation related findings.

  • Female genital mutilation related procedures:
    • [Refset](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|65f065d4-1f34-4d52-8aac-c18844bde150) FSN: Female genital mutilation related procedures simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)
    • [Refset](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|65f065d4-1f34-4d52-8aac-c18844bde150) Id: 999002031000000107

For further details relating to the [SNOMED CT Refset](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|65f065d4-1f34-4d52-8aac-c18844bde150) Metadata, see the [Data Dictionary for Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|92a9a14d-9380-495a-83d4-ed3dbcffa959) ([DD4C](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|92a9a14d-9380-495a-83d4-ed3dbcffa959)) website at: Female genital mutilation related procedures.

DATA EXTRACT SPECIFICATION

Description:

The [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) requires all [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396), [NHS Foundation Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195) and [GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|2948b99a-7255-4041-931c-3b4d63348a45) to generate and provide a data extract in accordance with the [Female Genital Mutilation Data Set](MC|DM|00fe221a-f61e-4102-ad8a-5a0821a11790). This requirement is applicable to all [CARE PROFESSIONALS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|8d8d3397-4680-4950-a62f-b2bf1dd855a6) in these [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) whenever it has been identified that a woman or young girl has undergone female genital mutilation.

Further information is available on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: Female Genital Mutilation Datasets.

Time period:

Data extracted from systems can be submitted as a bulk upload on a quarterly basis for each [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

Format:

Data submitted by the bulk upload facility must be formatted in 3 separate comma separated variable (csv) files (i.e. Patient, Attendance or Female Genital Mutilation), which are used to populate the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) Clinical Audit Platform. The data elements should be transmitted in the order specified in the [Female Genital Mutilation Data Set](MC|DM|00fe221a-f61e-4102-ad8a-5a0821a11790).

Transmission

Electronic files must be transmitted to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) via the Clinical Audit Platform which is a secure web portal.

Connection to the web portal requires registration to the Clinical Audit Platform, which will include the provision of a login account name and password.

Further information about the Clinical Audit Platform and the data upload facility can be found on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website: at Clinical Audit Platform.

Further guidance on the [Female Genital Mutilation Data Set](MC|DM|00fe221a-f61e-4102-ad8a-5a0821a11790) can be found on the on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: SCCI2026: Female Genital Mutilation Enhanced Dataset.

items.label: HES: Adult Critical care
items.description:
A data set within the Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) warehouse containing records of all  critical care in NHS hospitals in England.  It draws on records submitted by providers as an attachment to the admitted patient care record, so it covers critical care during hospital stay in:
* English NHS hospitals and 
* English NHS commissioned activity in the independent sector.
items.author: NHS Digital

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Urological
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 130 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished General Episode CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 130 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished General Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|03f9bb27-afb1-41c3-b1bd-8bc2ac8dd539) carries the data for a Finished General Episode.

It covers all NHS and private Admitted Patient Care (day case and inpatient) [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place in any:

  • acute, community, mental health [NHS Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) or [NHS Foundation Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195)
  • other NHS hospital
  • non-NHS hospitals or institutions where the care delivered is NHS-funded.

under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.  

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

Where the Care Activity data relates to a [Referral To Treatment Period Included In Referral To Treatment Consultant-Led Waiting Times Measurement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a9f64c7f-96ee-48f1-8199-cb614334d8de), the CDS DATA GROUP : PATIENT PATHWAY data elements must be completed where appropriate.

An Unfinished General Episode Commissioning Data Set record is required for all Unfinished General Episodes as at midnight on 31 March each year and for all unfinished short-stay informal psychiatric [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) who are resident in hospital or on leave of absence ([Home Leave](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4c1071ea-d090-461a-abde-21cc8d3108ee)) on 31 March and who have been in hospital for less than 12 months.

[CDS V6-2 Type 190 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished General Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|f9efd3d3-bf3b-4012-82ac-a90f9fb140ca) should be used for the submission of this Unfinished General Episode Commissioning Data Set.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction. 

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 130 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished General Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|03f9bb27-afb1-41c3-b1bd-8bc2ac8dd539) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2 TYPE 130 - APC FINISHED GENERAL EPISODE COMMISSIONING DATA SET
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To support the details of a Finished General Episode.
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|ebf9db2f-875b-4a5f-b32a-0fa27d3bfa93)
One per Interchange submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.
M 1..* DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1)
One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).

items.label: CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - CDS Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - CDS Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Type and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - CDS Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 011 - Emergency Care CDS](MC|DM|87087d78-978e-43e8-ac05-f069797422a5).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows. All [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) using the Commissioning Data Set Net Change Update Mechanism of the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol must begin with this Mandatory Data Group.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|a058bac6-ab46-47f7-ab7a-ec5a62c447a6) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|06d5317a-614c-415e-b5c7-26213fd2508f) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - CDS Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2-2 TYPE 005N - CDS TRANSACTION HEADER GROUP - NET CHANGE PROTOCOL
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To carry Commissioning Data Set identification and addressing data and other data indicating the specific use of one of the Update Mechanisms of the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - CDS Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94)
One per Commissioning Data Set record submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

items.label: Patient Reported Outcome Measures
items.description:
Patient Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs) measures health gain in patients undergoing one of the four elective common elective surgical procedures based on responses to questionnaires before and after surgery, including:
* hip replacement
* knee replacement
* varicose vein surgery
* groin hernia surgery.

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|0ca039a8-450a-4343-ac86-bf443239bad3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|0ca039a8-450a-4343-ac86-bf443239bad3) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2-1 TYPE 004 - COMMISSIONING DATA SET MESSAGE TRAILER
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To define the mandatory identity and addressing information for a Commissioning Data Set submission .
M 1..* DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2-1 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|0ca039a8-450a-4343-ac86-bf443239bad3)
One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Children Teenagers and Young Adults
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: Diagnostic Imaging Data Set
items.description:
The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) was introduced by ISB 1577 Diagnostic Imaging Data Set, in response to the lack of detailed data on national data on [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce) tests for NHS [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The original requirement came from the cancer strategy to improve [GP](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab) direct access to certain [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce) tests, as a method was required to monitor implementation of this policy.

The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333), however, has many benefits for example, to:

  • Provide NHS data on [GP](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab)s direct access to tests, as well as tests requested via other referral sources. Benchmarking data will be fed back to [GP](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab)s and, where appropriate, used to encourage increased use of tests, leading to earlier diagnosis and hence improved outcomes
  • Provide more detailed NHS data than is currently available on test type (modality), body site of test and [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) demographics
  • Enable analysis of turnaround times for tests
  • Enable better analysis of cancer pathways by linking the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) data to [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce) test data for cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)
  • Allow [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) ([PHE](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6)) to calculate more accurate estimates of the distribution of individual radiation dose estimates from medical exposures.

From April 2012 it became a mandatory requirement that all providers of NHS-funded [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce) tests for NHS [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) in England submit the central [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) on a monthly basis.

The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) facilitates the collection of clinical data and the sharing of such data to underpin the delivery of effective [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce). It is structured around the clinical processes of local Radiology Information Systems (RISs) used by [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) and [NHS Foundation Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195). It records administrative data relating to [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce) test [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff).

Information is collected relating exclusively to [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce) test [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff). The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) describes [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce) tests that have taken place as part of a broader [PATIENT PATHWAY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|4a2e987b-fdd8-4899-9abe-65cd4c0866aa). This includes [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) referred from within the [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6), either as an out-patient, in-patient or from [Accident and Emergency Departments](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|aff3dfba-dae7-4216-aa0a-f81992ccca3b), or referred directly from their [GP](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab) or another [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c).

The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) is collected from NHS funded providers of [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f1231af2-a8cc-400f-bdcc-e4cd28abe4ce) test [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) and submitted via a portal on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website. The submissions are processed and aggregate extracts are produced for provider and commissioner [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) and national groups such as the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) and [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6). This also allows linkage to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

Please note that the collection of the [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) does not replace any other collection of diagnostic data such as the Diagnostics Waiting Times and Activity Data Set (DM01), which should continue to be collected.

Data Set Order:

  • The transmission order of the [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) is different to the order of the items in the NHS Data Model and Dictionary and XML Schema.
  • Please see the "Guidance Notes" at: Diagnostic Imaging Dataset: Guidance for Data Submitters, which contains a full list of [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) fields in the order they are submitted.
  • Work is planned to amend some of the [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|104905c5-bf97-42ac-a223-cf318edc4333) items and when this is approved by the [Data Coordination Board](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|25154bbc-b21d-4d92-b1fc-b1660e413997) ([DCB](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|25154bbc-b21d-4d92-b1fc-b1660e413997)), the NHS Data Model and Dictionary will be updated to match.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 021 - Future Outpatient CDS
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2 Type 021 - Future Outpatient Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|1112c962-fe3a-4ce9-b30c-1f1b22bc92b4) carries the data for a Future Outpatient Attendance or a future cancelled [APPOINTMENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|970d415b-4a3d-4708-a2b1-4dc9b76d3653).

This [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) was not approved by the [Information Standards Board for Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|0bbcf5c9-d82a-4bb1-b70c-8c26006a8154) and submissions to support local activities and commissioning will be supported for piloting purposes only.

It covers all NHS and private Outpatient [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place in any:

  • acute, community, mental health [NHS Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) or [NHS Foundation Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195)
  • other NHS hospital
  • non-NHS hospitals or institutions where the care delivered is NHS-funded.

under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.  

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

This [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) must not be used for "Outpatients" - for this the [CDS V6-2 Type 020 - Outpatient Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|57e8a7ee-fe5a-41ca-b729-15bde19aa974) must be used.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

items.label: Myocardial Ischaemia National Audit Project (MINAP)
items.description:
The Myocardial Ischaemia National Audit Project (MINAP) is a national clinical audit of the management of heart attack. It supplies participating hospitals and ambulance services in England, Wales and Northern Ireland with a record of their management and compares this with nationally and internationally agreed standards. 
MINAP provides comparative data to help clinicians and managers to monitor and improve the quality and outcomes  of their local services. Its findings have been made public since 2003 via annual public reports when all eligible hospitals signed up to participate in the clinical audit - see Annual Reports section for the individual reports.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 005N - CDS Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|1879991f-da27-4e15-b097-43745796fcf0) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Type and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows. All [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) using the Commissioning Data Set Bulk Replacement Update Mechanism of the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol must begin with this Mandatory Data Group.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|ebf9db2f-875b-4a5f-b32a-0fa27d3bfa93) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|08041212-bd87-459b-a1ed-f68488bca030) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|1879991f-da27-4e15-b097-43745796fcf0) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|a5c4a6a0-ed3b-4a2a-b97b-694ecbd3e617) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|9705e684-2ff2-41aa-8e5d-b5c887243a52) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|1879991f-da27-4e15-b097-43745796fcf0) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2 TYPE 005N - CDS TRANSACTION HEADER GROUP - NET CHANGE PROTOCOL
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To carry Commissioning Data Set identification and addressing data and other data indicating the specific use of one of the Update Mechanisms of the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 110 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (New Service Agreement) CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 110 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (New Service Agreement) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|19e95a13-01a2-43ec-90be-14afa85e5685) used to make an initial report to a new Commissioner of an [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) that had previously been the responsibility of another Commissioner.

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.  

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) are intended for those [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) who have the capability to implement transaction-based processing, and are transmitted using Net Change Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.  They should be supplemented where required by an annual (or other agreed time-cycle) submission of the [CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27).

Note: for Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e), the [CDS UNIQUE IDENTIFIER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|de0def73-2435-44f4-a825-2e823cc40c88|8e343214-7563-4f1d-aa33-65910b696610), as held in the Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group, must be completed in order to provide the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|503f6c7d-2bca-4744-a546-d60892c2b795) identity.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 110 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (New Service Agreement) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|19e95a13-01a2-43ec-90be-14afa85e5685) is shown below.

items.label: Community Services Data Set
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The [Community Services Data Set](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2) ([null](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2)) is a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level, output based, secondary uses data set which will deliver robust, comprehensive, nationally consistent and comparable person-centred information for people who are in contact with NHS-funded [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30). As a secondary uses data set it intends to re-use clinical and operational data for purposes other than direct [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) care. It defines the data items, definitions and associated value sets to be extracted or derived from local systems.

The data collected in the [Community Services Data Set](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2) covers all NHS-funded [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30) provided by [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) in England. This includes all [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) listed in the [SERVICE OR TEAM TYPE REFERRED TO FOR COMMUNITY CARE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|dab92288-bc3c-4189-8a23-7a56192c0034|36ba1fd9-e41e-49a6-bc7f-1fd438d5bf0c) within the [Community Services Data Set](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2), including any [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) that have transitioned into new organisational forms as a result of the Transforming Community Services (TCS) programme. This includes acute and [Independent Sector Healthcare Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6731416e-8a17-4939-a8ba-152810150e08) that provide NHS-funded [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30).

The [Community Services Data Set](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2) is used by the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12), commissioners and [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) of [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30) and [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9), as the data set provides:

  • National, comparable, standardised data about [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30) that are being delivered, which will support intelligent commissioning decisions and [SERVICE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) provision
  • Information on the use of resources to improve the operational management of [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135)
  • Information on outcomes, to help to address health inequalities
  • Support for current national outcome indicators for [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30)
  • Traceability and visibility of [Community Health Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30) expenditure, allowing the implementation of new payment approaches for [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30) through the development of defined currencies which are underpinned by consistent data
  • Information to improve reference costs for [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30), to ensure that these are reported consistently
  • Support for a nationally consistent clinical record for all [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) across England, which can be used to support national research projects
  • Information for the future development of [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30).

Data Collection

The [Community Services Data Set](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2) provides the definitions for data to provide timely, pseudonymised [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)-based data and information for purposes other than direct clinical care, e.g. planning, commissioning, public health, clinical audit, performance improvement, research, clinical governance.

Data is expected to be collected from various clinical systems, collated and assembled. This standard is intended to facilitate electronic data recording and reporting but it is not intended to create clinical records for [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30) or to enable systems used by [Community Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f76e60ac-8252-4e24-b42f-faeffe21df30) to interoperate with other clinical systems.

Submission Information

The [Community Services Data Set](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2) is submitted via the [Strategic Data Collection Service in the Cloud](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d9261cc-cdeb-4c6f-a31f-4871ff466944) ([SDCS Cloud](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d9261cc-cdeb-4c6f-a31f-4871ff466944)) maintained by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) using the [Community Services Data Set](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2) ([null](MC|DM|1f947c63-7750-4798-9e52-803f1179cda2)) XML Schema.

Format Information

Data for submission will be formatted into an XML file as per the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas.

For enquiries regarding the XML Schema, please contact [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) at enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk.

Further Guidance

Further information and implementation guidance has been produced by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) and is available at:

  • Community Services Data Set
  • Community Services Data Set user guidance.

items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: National Joint Registry Data Set - Knee
items.description:
Background:

The National Joint Registry Data Set collects information on primary [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d) and revision [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d).

The majority of National Joint Registry Data Set items relate to the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s operation details and are collected in the [OPERATING THEATRE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|42a28a46-7b03-452d-be05-6f647fbb9994|b6def954-671e-435e-93cf-b447d1b9310e).

The National Codes for National Joint Registry items match the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) bulk upload codes / system generated codes.

[PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) must give their consent for this data to be recorded on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) Data Entry System (the electronic system for collection and transfer of data). 

Note: the consent is for data in the 'Patient Identifiers' group. Where consent is not given, the 'Patient Details' group and the operation details are still recorded.

Operations included in the National Joint Registry database:

  • [Primary Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4a69cd6c-786e-4980-8735-dcf86ad64eb7)
  • [Revision Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f2f87cd5-7b90-47bb-b9ca-7ba60586c425)
  • [Primary Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7804da41-fec7-41a2-89f3-c946a18aac66)
  • [Revision Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7985d1d9-516c-4be6-9c0a-47806031c91b)
  • [Primary Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|41c4323f-80e5-4b1f-a253-14b75ecb8c8d)
  • [Revision Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|36ba0887-a041-4add-b5b6-5fa914bbfa26)
  • [Primary Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db80b9d1-f233-4e32-a9a5-b2140a7e471a)
  • [Revision Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|266027dd-7765-4754-bbce-1a95eba960ff)
  • [Primary Shoulder Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|144ed8ce-790d-4e09-b14f-933962c2b1fd)
  • [Revision Shoulder Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|50c2ddcf-9caf-4b65-b26c-c926b02b5394)

Further Guidance:

Further guidance can be found:

  • For background to the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) on the:
    • [Healthcare Quality Improvement Partnership](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c9ead133-bb32-441d-b640-ca4b20ca3110) website at: About the NJR
    • [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) website at: Welcome from the National Joint Registry of England, Wales and Northern Ireland

  • Relating to the data set on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) website at: NJR data set.

items.label: HIC: National Renal Dataset v2.2
items.description:
The National Renal Data Set (NRD) provides the specification of information to be collected by the NHS to support implementation of the National Service Framework for Renal Services. This information will be used by kidney care services to assess their achievement of the quality standards and to improve kidney care for patients.

The NRD has been approved as a full operational information standard by the Information Standards Board (ISB) for Health and Social Care. The data set is mandated for collection by the Department of Health, sponsored by Dr Donal O'Donoghue, National Clinical Director for Kidney Care.

Changes to the data set were approved by ISB in November 2010. The data items and the mandation dates are specified in NRD v2.2 which is available from the document download section of this web page. Additional guidance documents are also located there, including a conformance checklist. This is a tool for services and systems suppliers to use to assess their state of readiness for collection of the data.

The data set extends the existing collections of the UK Renal Registry, UK Transplant and the British Association of Paediatric Nephrologists. Data collection and submission of the NRD will be included within these existing collection mechanisms.

The data set was developed in partnership with the following organisations;
- The Renal Association UK Renal Registry
- NHS Blood and Transplant
- British Association of Paediatric Nephrologists
- British Renal Society
- British Transplantation Society
- National Kidney Federation
- English Renal Units
items.author: Health Informatics Collaborative

items.label: National Cancer Waiting Times Monitoring Data Set
items.description:
Introduction:

The information in the [National Cancer Waiting Times Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|282884ea-3e19-4e5d-a81a-4bfef9b4d25d) is required to provide details on cancer [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) in England. This enables the performance monitoring of [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) and [Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) in order to maintain and increase standards across England.

Cancer Waiting Times data relates to:

  • the waiting time requirements outlined in the 'NHS Cancer Plan (2000)' and the 'Cancer Reform Strategy (2007)' and
  • a performance standard that [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) should wait no longer than 28 days from initial referral by a [GENERAL PRACTITIONER](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab) to diagnosis or ruling out of cancer (the 28 Day Faster Diagnosis Standard) introduced by the Independent Cancer Taskforce, 'Achieving World-Class Cancer Outcomes'.

The 'Cancer Reform Strategy (2007)' introduced new and changed commitments in terms of service standards for cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) that must be met. A Review of Cancer Waiting Times Standards was carried out by the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) and published alongside 'Improving Outcomes: A Strategy for Cancer (2011)'.

The [National Cancer Waiting Times Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|282884ea-3e19-4e5d-a81a-4bfef9b4d25d) supports the continued management and monitoring of the following waiting times:

  • A maximum two week wait from an urgent [GENERAL PRACTITIONER](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab) referral for suspected cancer to [DATE FIRST SEEN](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|6036b333-6ccb-4a01-94c5-d472feeaee5e|345179b3-0b81-443b-b5ff-794baa8c8b8c) by a specialist for all suspected cancers
  • A maximum 28 day wait from an urgent [GENERAL PRACTITIONER](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab) referral for suspected cancer to having cancer either diagnosed or ruled out ([CANCER FASTER DIAGNOSIS PATHWAY END DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|db9f5d32-d900-4d91-983c-f794202a41d4|3fb67445-25c2-4406-85a2-4c44093998c7)), or [DECISION TO TREAT DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|43d9b3d8-bd44-49c4-bd93-33f657cb6768|4a480071-0ea0-4b89-8804-ea8159fce2fc), whichever comes first, for all suspected cancers
  • A maximum 28 day wait from referral for breast symptoms (where cancer is not initially suspected) to having cancer either diagnosed or ruled out ([CANCER FASTER DIAGNOSIS PATHWAY END DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|db9f5d32-d900-4d91-983c-f794202a41d4|3fb67445-25c2-4406-85a2-4c44093998c7)), or [DECISION TO TREAT DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|43d9b3d8-bd44-49c4-bd93-33f657cb6768|4a480071-0ea0-4b89-8804-ea8159fce2fc), whichever comes first, for all suspected cancers
  • A maximum 28 day wait from a referral to an Assessment [CLINIC OR FACILITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|285c3335-c334-4c0e-8387-b2f8e6ff99f8) following the identification of an abnormality by an NHS Cancer [Screening Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|48ec20bf-cf2d-446d-a6a9-b61948c48961) to having cancer either diagnosed or ruled out ([CANCER FASTER DIAGNOSIS PATHWAY END DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|db9f5d32-d900-4d91-983c-f794202a41d4|3fb67445-25c2-4406-85a2-4c44093998c7)), or [DECISION TO TREAT DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|43d9b3d8-bd44-49c4-bd93-33f657cb6768|4a480071-0ea0-4b89-8804-ea8159fce2fc), whichever comes first, for all suspected cancers
  • A maximum one month (31-day) wait from diagnosis ([CANCER TREATMENT PERIOD START DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|db9f5d32-d900-4d91-983c-f794202a41d4|8109c1b6-b5dc-404a-ad13-3734d084bc81)) to [First Definitive Treatment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a4c50d4e-9579-4100-9f00-2ffe3aeb56f7) for all cancers
  • A maximum two month (62-day) wait from urgent [GENERAL PRACTITIONER](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab) referral for suspected cancer to [First Definitive Treatment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a4c50d4e-9579-4100-9f00-2ffe3aeb56f7) for all cancers
  • A maximum one month (31-day) wait from urgent [GENERAL PRACTITIONER](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|94d686ac-4ef2-4366-833a-9174633e6bab) referral for suspected cancer to [First Definitive Treatment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a4c50d4e-9579-4100-9f00-2ffe3aeb56f7) for childrens cancers, testicular cancers and acute leukaemia
  • A maximum 62-day wait from referral from an NHS Cancer [Screening Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e4ebcb97-d550-4b5b-bd85-a8610b3e7955) to [First Definitive Treatment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a4c50d4e-9579-4100-9f00-2ffe3aeb56f7) for all cancers
  • A maximum 62-day wait from a [CONSULTANTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0) decision to upgrade the urgency of a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) they suspect to have cancer to [First Definitive Treatment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a4c50d4e-9579-4100-9f00-2ffe3aeb56f7) for all cancers
  • A maximum 31-day wait for all subsequent treatments for new cases of primary and [Recurrent Cancer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7b11eba0-5478-43c0-8f3a-4893a9ac4797) where an [Anti-Cancer Drug Regimen](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|85724f0e-b253-4e0b-8d5e-b4ed98c7ad3c), surgery or [Radiotherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3b1e96ec-7a3a-4e48-8a08-2427a9a2bbed) is the chosen [CANCER TREATMENT MODALITY](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1bf8ce51-8761-4674-a494-7edb028deb60|c9ee9399-39ab-4a49-83fe-c60d3f692e34)
  • A maximum two week wait from referral for breast symptoms (where cancer is not initially suspected) to [DATE FIRST SEEN](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|6036b333-6ccb-4a01-94c5-d472feeaee5e|345179b3-0b81-443b-b5ff-794baa8c8b8c).

Patient Pathway Scenarios:

The Patient Pathway Scenarios for the [National Cancer Waiting Times Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|282884ea-3e19-4e5d-a81a-4bfef9b4d25d) are to be used to manage the collection of data for all [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) suspected of having, or diagnosed with cancer.

Transmission:

  • Data can be transmitted to the Cancer Waiting Times System through any of three routes:
    • Bulk upload via an XML file
    • Bulk upload via a CSV file
    • Single record entry through the Cancer Waiting Times Submission portal
  • The specification for CSV upload file is detailed in the National Cancer Waiting Times User Manual available on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website
  • Data for XML submission will be formatted into an XML file as per [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas
  • Once data is transmitted to the Cancer Waiting Times system it will undergo further validation. Details of this validation is available on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: Cancer Waiting Times.

Further guidance:

  • Further guidance relating to the [National Cancer Waiting Times Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|282884ea-3e19-4e5d-a81a-4bfef9b4d25d) is available on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: Cancer Waiting Times.
  • Queries regarding the [National Cancer Waiting Times Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|282884ea-3e19-4e5d-a81a-4bfef9b4d25d) should be addressed to england.cancerwaitsdata@nhs.net.

items.label: ADMITTED PATIENT CARE CDS TYPE - OTHER DELIVERY
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.
