Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Emergency Care
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set is used to standardise the method of reporting cost information at [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level. All designated NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) of acute activity are required to submit [Patient Level Information Costing](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46533a5a-17b1-4a64-b31b-e0dc56e90b09) data.

The Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set is used to

  • inform new methods of pricing NHS [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135);
  • inform new approaches and other changes to the design of the currencies used to price NHS [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135);
  • contribute to [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc)'s strategic objective of a single national cost collection by 2020 inform the relationship between provider characteristics and cost;
  • help [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) to maximise use of their resources and improve efficiencies, as required by the provider licence;
  • identify the relationship between [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) characteristics and cost;
  • support an approach to benchmarking for regulatory purposes.

Data Extract Specification

Description

[NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) has mandated designated [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) and [NHS Foundation Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195) to record and report:

  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Admitted Patient Care](MC|DM|a5c5598c-245a-49e6-8368-c9ec998027b3)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Emergency Care](MC|DM|2d53de74-c588-4041-b6e1-d4589b69f22b)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Out-Patient Care](MC|DM|6a89b75d-50b8-4b61-b1b9-efed958b4c80)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Reconciliation](MC|DM|baa8fa6c-4f52-47a4-850c-d0edb78f855d)

Reporting is required at the end of each financial year, consistent with the methodologies and submission processes in the Approved Costing Guidance. This only includes those NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) noted in the Costing Mandation Timetable and does not include non-NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c).

Time

The data is collected annually. It must be submitted in accordance with the timetable set out by [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) in the National Cost Collection Guidance (part of the Approved Costing Guidance).

Format

The data should be submitted in an XML file, created by [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc)'s Data Validation Tool (DVT). Information on how to access and use this tool is included in the National Cost Collection Guidance (part of the Approved Costing Guidance).

Transmission

[Patient Level Information Costing](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46533a5a-17b1-4a64-b31b-e0dc56e90b09) data will be submitted to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) using [Secure Electronic File Transfer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581) ([SEFT](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581)). [Secure Electronic File Transfer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581) ([SEFT](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581)) can only be accessed by registered and approved users and [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) will invite relevant people to register for the service and provide details of the log in process.

items.label: National Joint Registry Data Set - Common Details
items.description:
Background:

The National Joint Registry Data Set collects information on primary [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d) and revision [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d).

The majority of National Joint Registry Data Set items relate to the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s operation details and are collected in the [OPERATING THEATRE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|42a28a46-7b03-452d-be05-6f647fbb9994|b6def954-671e-435e-93cf-b447d1b9310e).

The National Codes for National Joint Registry items match the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) bulk upload codes / system generated codes.

[PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) must give their consent for this data to be recorded on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) Data Entry System (the electronic system for collection and transfer of data). 

Note: the consent is for data in the 'Patient Identifiers' group. Where consent is not given, the 'Patient Details' group and the operation details are still recorded.

Operations included in the National Joint Registry database:

  • [Primary Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4a69cd6c-786e-4980-8735-dcf86ad64eb7)
  • [Revision Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f2f87cd5-7b90-47bb-b9ca-7ba60586c425)
  • [Primary Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7804da41-fec7-41a2-89f3-c946a18aac66)
  • [Revision Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7985d1d9-516c-4be6-9c0a-47806031c91b)
  • [Primary Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|41c4323f-80e5-4b1f-a253-14b75ecb8c8d)
  • [Revision Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|36ba0887-a041-4add-b5b6-5fa914bbfa26)
  • [Primary Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db80b9d1-f233-4e32-a9a5-b2140a7e471a)
  • [Revision Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|266027dd-7765-4754-bbce-1a95eba960ff)
  • [Primary Shoulder Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|144ed8ce-790d-4e09-b14f-933962c2b1fd)
  • [Revision Shoulder Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|50c2ddcf-9caf-4b65-b26c-c926b02b5394)

Further Guidance:

Further guidance can be found:

  • For background to the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) on the:
    • [Healthcare Quality Improvement Partnership](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c9ead133-bb32-441d-b640-ca4b20ca3110) website at: About the NJR
    • [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) website at: Welcome from the National Joint Registry of England, Wales and Northern Ireland

  • Relating to the data set on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) website at: NJR data set.

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Upper Gastrointestinal
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27) carries the data for all booked, planned and waiting list admissions.

This consists of records for [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) waiting for [Elective Admission](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|38246769-fa26-41e3-a110-0aaf89538c25) at a specified date and should be sent to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) within one month of the end of the period to which they relate unless a shorter time-scale has been agreed with the recipient.

Some [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) also send a final [CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27) after the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has been removed from the [WAITING LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ddbf9ee6-2fcd-4b2b-b073-16c0514bc527|32ef8dde-939d-4367-a060-1c93f91e26ca) to identify when and why this took place. Commissioners who do not wish to use such final Elective Admission List-End Of Period Census Commissioning Data Sets should ignore them.

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

Where the Care Activity data relates to a [Referral To Treatment Period Included In Referral To Treatment Consultant-Led Waiting Times Measurement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a9f64c7f-96ee-48f1-8199-cb614334d8de), the CDS DATA GROUP : PATIENT PATHWAY data elements must be completed where appropriate.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: CDS INTERCHANGE TRAILER
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: National Joint Registry Data Set - Ankle
items.description:
Background:

The National Joint Registry Data Set collects information on primary [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d) and revision [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d).

The majority of National Joint Registry Data Set items relate to the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s operation details and are collected in the [OPERATING THEATRE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|42a28a46-7b03-452d-be05-6f647fbb9994|b6def954-671e-435e-93cf-b447d1b9310e).

The National Codes for National Joint Registry items match the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) bulk upload codes / system generated codes.

[PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) must give their consent for this data to be recorded on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) Data Entry System (the electronic system for collection and transfer of data). 

Note: the consent is for data in the 'Patient Identifiers' group. Where consent is not given, the 'Patient Details' group and the operation details are still recorded.

Operations included in the National Joint Registry database:

  • [Primary Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4a69cd6c-786e-4980-8735-dcf86ad64eb7)
  • [Revision Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f2f87cd5-7b90-47bb-b9ca-7ba60586c425)
  • [Primary Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7804da41-fec7-41a2-89f3-c946a18aac66)
  • [Revision Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7985d1d9-516c-4be6-9c0a-47806031c91b)
  • [Primary Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|41c4323f-80e5-4b1f-a253-14b75ecb8c8d)
  • [Revision Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|36ba0887-a041-4add-b5b6-5fa914bbfa26)
  • [Primary Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db80b9d1-f233-4e32-a9a5-b2140a7e471a)
  • [Revision Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|266027dd-7765-4754-bbce-1a95eba960ff)
  • [Primary Shoulder Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|144ed8ce-790d-4e09-b14f-933962c2b1fd)
  • [Revision Shoulder Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|50c2ddcf-9caf-4b65-b26c-c926b02b5394)

Further Guidance:

Further guidance can be found:

  • For background to the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) on the:
    • [Healthcare Quality Improvement Partnership](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c9ead133-bb32-441d-b640-ca4b20ca3110) website at: About the NJR
    • [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) website at: Welcome from the National Joint Registry of England, Wales and Northern Ireland

  • Relating to the data set on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) website at: NJR data set.

items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Breast
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - CDS Interchange Trailer
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Interchange and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 011 - Emergency Care CDS](MC|DM|87087d78-978e-43e8-ac05-f069797422a5).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|a058bac6-ab46-47f7-ab7a-ec5a62c447a6) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|06d5317a-614c-415e-b5c7-26213fd2508f) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2-2 TYPE 002 - CDS INTERCHANGE TRAILER
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To define the mandatory identity and addressing information for a Commissioning Data Set submission .
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2)
One per Interchange submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: CDS TRANSACTION HEADER GROUP NET CHANGE
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: NHS Continuing Healthcare Patient Level Data Set
items.description:
Introduction

The [NHS Continuing Healthcare Patient Level Data Set](MC|DM|358c4d61-ca33-4e88-a4b3-e75b9ade463a) is [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level, output based, secondary user data set. It delivers robust, comprehensive, nationally consistent and comparable [PERSON](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) centred information for people who are in receipt of, or whose eligibility is being assessed for, [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) or [NHS-funded Nursing Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|23372bf6-71ef-4109-8eda-be7ae7030c78). The data set does not include information about requests for an independent review of an [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) eligibility decision.

As a secondary uses data set the [NHS Continuing Healthcare Patient Level Data Set](MC|DM|358c4d61-ca33-4e88-a4b3-e75b9ade463a) re-uses operational data for purposes other than direct [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) care. It defines the data items, definitions and associated value sets to be extracted or derived from local systems.

The data collected in the [NHS Continuing Healthcare Patient Level Data Set](MC|DM|358c4d61-ca33-4e88-a4b3-e75b9ade463a) covers all [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) and [NHS-funded Nursing Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|23372bf6-71ef-4109-8eda-be7ae7030c78) [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) undertaken by [Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) (or other [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) acting on their behalf), in line with the [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) (National Framework) in England.

The [NHS Continuing Healthcare Patient Level Data Set](MC|DM|358c4d61-ca33-4e88-a4b3-e75b9ade463a) is used by the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12), [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) and [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc), commissioners and [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9), as the data set provides:

  • National, comparable, standardised data about [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) and [NHS-funded Nursing Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|23372bf6-71ef-4109-8eda-be7ae7030c78), which will support intelligent commissioning decisions and [SERVICE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) provision
  • Information on the use of resources to improve the operational management of [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135)
  • Support for current national performance indicators for [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) 
  • Information for the future development of [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) and [NHS-funded Nursing Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|23372bf6-71ef-4109-8eda-be7ae7030c78).

Data Collection

The [NHS Continuing Healthcare Patient Level Data Set](MC|DM|358c4d61-ca33-4e88-a4b3-e75b9ade463a) provides the definitions for data to:

  • be lodged in the data warehouse regularly and routinely,
  • be assembled, compiled and to flow into a secondary uses data warehouse,
  • provide timely, pseudonymised [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) based data and information for purposes other than direct clinical care, e.g. planning, commissioning, public health, performance improvement, research, clinical governance.

Data is expected to be extracted and collated from the [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) management systems used by [Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) to manage their  [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) function.

Data will be reported monthly.

Submission Information

The [NHS Continuing Healthcare Patient Level Data Set](MC|DM|358c4d61-ca33-4e88-a4b3-e75b9ade463a) is submitted to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23)  using the  [NHS Continuing Healthcare Patient Level Data Set](MC|DM|358c4d61-ca33-4e88-a4b3-e75b9ade463a) XML Schema.

Format Information

Data for submission will be formatted into an XML file as per the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas.

For enquiries regarding the XML Schema, please contact [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) at enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk.

Further Guidance

Further information and implementation guidance has been produced by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) and is available at: NHS Continuing Healthcare and NHS-funded Nursing Care (CHC).

items.label: NHS Continuing Healthcare Data Set
items.description:
The [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) introduced the National framework for NHS continuing healthcare and NHS-funded nursing care in 2007 to establish a consistent and standardised guide to implementing the delivery of [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) ([NHS CHC](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932)). This was last revised in March 2018 and replaces the previous 2012 version. The National Framework sets out [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) and assessment processes. The latest version places a strong focus on moving assessments outside of an acute setting.

[NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) is a package of ongoing care that is 100% funded solely by the NHS where the [PERSON](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) has been found to have a primary health need as set out in the National framework for NHS continuing healthcare and NHS funded nursing care. Such care is provided to a [PERSON](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) aged 18 or over, to meet needs that have arisen as a result of disability, accident or illness.

In order to monitor the implementation and effectiveness of the Framework, a mandatory collection requires the submission of quarterly figures on [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) and [NHS-funded Nursing Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|23372bf6-71ef-4109-8eda-be7ae7030c78) activity.

The collection includes:

  • [PERSONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) aged 18 or over eligible for [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) as defined by the National framework for NHS continuing healthcare and NHS-funded nursing care. 
  • [PERSONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) still recognised as eligible under the former [Strategic Health Authorities](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|23c034a9-4ea8-43c5-9d5f-87e86898ec28)' eligibility criteria.
  • [PERSONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) identified as eligible for [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) following assessment of eligibility for [null](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a52e03d6-9f99-4125-adb4-04aa6e1784e4) ([PUPoC](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a52e03d6-9f99-4125-adb4-04aa6e1784e4)). This includes [Previously Unassessed Periods of Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a52e03d6-9f99-4125-adb4-04aa6e1784e4) related to the closedown announcement made by the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) in 2012 in which deadlines were introduced for requesting assessments of eligibility for past periods of care falling between 1st April 2004 and 31st March 2012. This also includes non-closedown [Previously Unassessed Periods of Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a52e03d6-9f99-4125-adb4-04aa6e1784e4) relating to assessments of eligibility for past periods of care falling after 31st March 2012.

The collection excludes:

  • [PERSONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) funded through other NHS funding streams which are not [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) or [NHS-funded Nursing Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|23372bf6-71ef-4109-8eda-be7ae7030c78)
    [PERSONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) funded under any section of the Mental Health Act. The exception to this is if an individual is funded under a Mental Health Section and eligible for [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) under the National Framework eligibility criteria. In these instances the activity related to the [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) package is still included but any activity covered by the Mental Health section should be excluded
  • Interim Cases - [PERSONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) receiving temporary [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) funding pending eligibility decision or [PERSONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) who have ceased being eligible but are still being funded
  • [PERSONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) under 18 years of age. [NHS Continuing Healthcare](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3af947aa-3b9b-4478-86af-08dcbfbfa932) packages are funded for individuals aged 18 and over only therefore only individuals aged 18 years or over are included in this return.

The [NHS Continuing Healthcare Data Set](MC|DM|3b3fb5c6-ee1e-42db-ab44-e80339f8f15a) is transmitted at aggregate level to the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) [Strategic Data Collection Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|77f0392c-a996-41d1-b528-3d8d56a18408) ([SDCS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|77f0392c-a996-41d1-b528-3d8d56a18408)) with publication outputs available on the [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) website at: NHS Continuing Healthcare and NHS-funded Nursing Care.

For further information on the [NHS Continuing Healthcare Data Set](MC|DM|3b3fb5c6-ee1e-42db-ab44-e80339f8f15a), see the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) part of the gov.uk website at: National framework for NHS continuing healthcare and NHS-funded nursing care.

items.label: Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Data Set
items.description:
Introduction:

The [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Data Set](MC|DM|3f759644-5107-4034-8ac9-e495bd0b9e07) collects clinical management information on [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) undergoing [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a1da37ef-b980-4dd6-a51e-992d1531947c) in (or funded by) the NHS in England.

In the clinical setting its primary use is in prescribing and administering [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a1da37ef-b980-4dd6-a51e-992d1531947c). The standard also specifies secondary uses information about [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a1da37ef-b980-4dd6-a51e-992d1531947c) which is required to assist in achieving, supporting and monitoring the NHS Operating Framework, specialised commissioning and related policy.

Details of Standard:

The [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Data Set](MC|DM|3f759644-5107-4034-8ac9-e495bd0b9e07) relates to all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9), both adult and paediatric, in both admitted [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) care and outpatient and community settings, who are receiving [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a1da37ef-b980-4dd6-a51e-992d1531947c) for all solid [Tumour](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|580b723c-430f-47b0-9a54-158d3ca088c7) and haematological malignancies, including those treated in [CLINICAL TRIALS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|4a19b6bc-ae83-4a42-8c2d-c61811d4fc24).

The [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Data Set](MC|DM|3f759644-5107-4034-8ac9-e495bd0b9e07) covers the period from the [Start Date](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|34a9ff10-ce5e-4eec-8563-9dffb82a4727) of the [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Regimen](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a45d0f9a-e1a3-4617-be86-bc6776cdfa03) to the [Start Date](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|34a9ff10-ce5e-4eec-8563-9dffb82a4727) of the last [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Cycle](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a4f9dcab-b81b-488f-8a2c-4df412cd94c9).

Note: [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) may end their treatment with an oral or other component taken at home. Although the dispensing of this will be recorded in the final [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Cycle](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a4f9dcab-b81b-488f-8a2c-4df412cd94c9), it is not possible to confirm that the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has taken the medication.

Data Set Structure and Transmission:

[Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a1da37ef-b980-4dd6-a51e-992d1531947c) is given over a prolonged period of time, often months or years, comprising repeating and sequential elements.  The [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) may attend two or more [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) during the course of treatment.

In order to track the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) during treatment, the data set must be capable of linking all the elements of care in a consistent and ordered way. In order to achieve this, the [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Data Set](MC|DM|3f759644-5107-4034-8ac9-e495bd0b9e07) has a branching structure which links the initial data fields, which will remain constant during the treatment, with detail of each [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Regimen](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a45d0f9a-e1a3-4617-be86-bc6776cdfa03), [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Cycle](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a4f9dcab-b81b-488f-8a2c-4df412cd94c9) and [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Administration](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|365ad15b-5dda-4857-a32b-f2ba536c07d4).  At the completion or cessation of a [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Regimen](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a45d0f9a-e1a3-4617-be86-bc6776cdfa03), the outcome section must link back to all previous fields. It must be possible to reconstitute details of each [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)s sequential management from the serial downloads received.

All [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) and [NHS Foundation Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195) providing [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|2406ff76-ed6d-4d28-9165-06b220e8a98e) are required to submit monthly data downloads to an agreed timetable, two months in arrears. These data must represent all treatment activity in the month period, including [Systemic Anti-Cancer Therapy Drug Regimens](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a45d0f9a-e1a3-4617-be86-bc6776cdfa03) started and completed or ceased in the [REPORTING PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|b5f965ea-f3f6-4c01-b6fe-0cb8ef9f063c).

The data repository is hosted by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) and the data is held under their section 251 of the [National Health Service Act 2006](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|78f9684d-7a3e-46c2-9faa-cbd55335f6ab).

Data downloads is by csv and will uniquely identify the [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c).

Further Guidance:

Detailed technical guidance on the processes required, and any required updates, is available from the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) in the Technical Guidance documents supporting the programme.

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Liver
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Head and Neck
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 080 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Offer) CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 080 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Offer) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|4119b772-438c-4992-89c6-9d9b3a6bb48d) is used to report that an [OFFER OF ADMISSION](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|42a28a46-7b03-452d-be05-6f647fbb9994|d5089e3a-72ff-4606-8b6e-d2d0505ab011) has been made to the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9).

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists. 

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) are intended for those [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) who have the capability to implement transaction-based processing, and are transmitted using Net Change Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.  They should be supplemented where required by an annual (or other agreed time-cycle) submission of the [CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27).

Where the Care Activity data relates to a [Referral To Treatment Period Included In Referral To Treatment Consultant-Led Waiting Times Measurement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a9f64c7f-96ee-48f1-8199-cb614334d8de), the CDS DATA GROUP : PATIENT PATHWAY data elements must be completed where appropriate.

Note: for Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e), the [CDS UNIQUE IDENTIFIER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|de0def73-2435-44f4-a825-2e823cc40c88|8e343214-7563-4f1d-aa33-65910b696610), as held in the Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group, must be completed in order to provide the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|503f6c7d-2bca-4744-a546-d60892c2b795) identity. 

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 080 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Offer) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|4119b772-438c-4992-89c6-9d9b3a6bb48d) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - CDS Message Header
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Message and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 011 - Emergency Care CDS](MC|DM|87087d78-978e-43e8-ac05-f069797422a5).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|a058bac6-ab46-47f7-ab7a-ec5a62c447a6) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|06d5317a-614c-415e-b5c7-26213fd2508f) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2-2 TYPE 003 - CDS MESSAGE HEADER
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To define the mandatory identity and addressing information for a Commissioning Data Set submission .
M 1..* DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81)
One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.
