items.label: GUMCAD Sexually Transmitted Infection Surveillance System Data Set
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The [GUMCAD Sexually Transmitted Infection Surveillance System Data Set](MC|DM|43c35185-4ff7-4b9b-bb51-d7e1944ebab5) provides essential public health information about Sexually Transmitted Infection (STI) diagnoses, treatments and [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) provided by [Level 3 Genitourinary Medicine Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|b35c55b2-2881-4c19-8171-f9ed63d4e99f) and commissioned [Level 2 Sexual Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a2ddccbe-b5b4-402e-99bd-b60763a572b2).

The [GUMCAD Sexually Transmitted Infection Surveillance System Data Set](MC|DM|43c35185-4ff7-4b9b-bb51-d7e1944ebab5) is used:

  • To inform public health response and policy formulation for England
  • To monitor the effectiveness of the policies introduced as part of the National Strategy for Sexual Health and Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)
  • For performance management at local and national level to ensure delivery of the national Public Service Agreement target on [Sexual Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d5fd5fbe-64e8-4ce2-bd0f-1aff2f0b94b0)
  • For better planning and management of [Sexual Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d5fd5fbe-64e8-4ce2-bd0f-1aff2f0b94b0) at local level
  • To adapt and refine clinical interventions, as appropriate

DATA EXTRACT SPECIFICATION

Description:

[Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) require [Sexual Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d5fd5fbe-64e8-4ce2-bd0f-1aff2f0b94b0) to generate and provide a data extract in accordance with the [GUMCAD Sexually Transmitted Infection Surveillance System Data Set](MC|DM|43c35185-4ff7-4b9b-bb51-d7e1944ebab5). These [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) include:

  • NHS providers of specialised [Level 3 Genitourinary Medicine Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|b35c55b2-2881-4c19-8171-f9ed63d4e99f), where the primary function of the specialist clinical multidisciplinary team is concerned with the provision of screening, diagnosis and management of Sexually Transmitted Infections and related genital medical conditions.
  • All [Level 2 Sexual Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a2ddccbe-b5b4-402e-99bd-b60763a572b2) commissioned by the NHS who offer testing, diagnostic and/or treatment of Sexually Transmitted Infections.


It should be noted that [General Practitioners with Extended Roles](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|494e9aac-5c3e-40e9-a123-ec78d4aacd99) ([GPwER](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|494e9aac-5c3e-40e9-a123-ec78d4aacd99)s) will only be included if they operate from a [General Medical Practitioner Practice](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|683309e3-8c9f-46ac-903e-c12fc0ccafac) that has been commissioned to provide a [Level 2 Sexual Health Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a2ddccbe-b5b4-402e-99bd-b60763a572b2).

Time period: The extract must cover one calendar quarter.

Frequency: Reports must be run quarterly, 6 weeks after the end of the quarter.

Format: Data returned must be formatted into a single comma separated variable (csv) file. The data elements should be transmitted in the order specified in the [GUMCAD Sexually Transmitted Infection Surveillance System Data Set](MC|DM|43c35185-4ff7-4b9b-bb51-d7e1944ebab5).

Transmission: Electronic files must be transmitted to [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) through a secure web portal on the [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) website. This web portal enables [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) to submit data files in a secure manner to the HIV and STI Department of [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6).  The web portal can be found at HIV & STI web portal.

Connection to the web portal requires a login account name and password at [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6). Please contact gumcad@phe.org.uk for access or more information.

Further guidance on the [GUMCAD Sexually Transmitted Infection Surveillance System Data Set](MC|DM|43c35185-4ff7-4b9b-bb51-d7e1944ebab5) can be found on the [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) part of the gov.uk website at: STI Surveillance, data, screening and management.

items.label: NHS Health Checks Data Set
items.description:
The [NHS Health Checks Data Set](MC|DM|48693392-04be-4aa9-bdaa-d66cfdbceda3) is used to

  • Support a uniform, quality and safe [NHS Health Check Assessment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|16d6252f-f9b5-4a0e-a70d-e0c6bebd73ba) for all those eligible between the age of 40 and 74 in England.
  • Ensure that everyone who is eligible for the check will receive the same face to face national offer wherever their check is conducted.
  • Help estimate the impact of the [NHS Health Check Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|0e0d2476-c814-45eb-8353-6917a769bf77) on local services and enable commissioners to be more responsive and effective in their commissioning of services to support the [NHS Health Check Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|0e0d2476-c814-45eb-8353-6917a769bf77).
  • Provide a common and understood interface for Primary Care clinical system suppliers to support the process of risk assessment and [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) care.
  • Support the reporting of [NHS Health Check Assessment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|16d6252f-f9b5-4a0e-a70d-e0c6bebd73ba) data for performance management and research purposes.

DATA EXTRACT SPECIFICATION

The [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) require NHS Primary Care System Suppliers to extract data, apply documented derivation rules and then securely transmit to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), where the information will be validated and stored for [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) analysis.

The data extract consists of anonymised demographic data and a limited set of clinical observations. The data does not constitute the full [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) record.

Time period: The extract covers one calendar quarter.

Frequency: Reports are run quarterly, 6 weeks after the end of the quarter.

Format: Data for submission will be formatted into an XML file as per the [NHS Health Checks Data Set](MC|DM|48693392-04be-4aa9-bdaa-d66cfdbceda3) Message.

Transmission: Electronic files are transmitted to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) via an encrypted web based portal hosted at [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23). This web portal enables delegated system suppliers to submit data files in a secure manner across the Internet after derivation rules have been applied.

Guidance and information on derivation rules, READ format mappings and transmission protocols are available from [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23).

Further guidance on the [NHS Health Checks Data Set](MC|DM|48693392-04be-4aa9-bdaa-d66cfdbceda3) can be found on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: NHS Health Check Data Set.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 120 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Birth Episode CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 120 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|48a8c2fa-a0ce-469d-b72d-e05176cd907e) carries the data for a Finished Birth Episode.

This is required when a delivery has resulted in a [REGISTRABLE BIRTH](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|44f45a63-0b99-426a-a156-877f0a143854) which has taken place in either an NHS Hospital or in an non-NHS [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) funded by the NHS.

The information is taken from the birth notification for each baby born.

In addition to Finished Birth Episodes, Unfinished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set records are required for all Unfinished Birth Episodes as at midnight on 31st March each year.

[CDS V6-2 Type 180 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6fab2f94-05e8-4d1a-8cc3-1885f056bcc3) should be used for the submission of this Unfinished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 120 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|48a8c2fa-a0ce-469d-b72d-e05176cd907e) is shown below.

items.label: Information Sharing to Tackle Violence Minimum Data Set
items.description:
The purpose of the [Information Sharing to Tackle Violence Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|49c64590-d8ba-47ce-8525-d5eb9567fd0d) is to enable the collection of anonymised information on those [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) presenting at  [Accident and Emergency Departments](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|aff3dfba-dae7-4216-aa0a-f81992ccca3b) for treatment as a result of a violent assault.  This information is to be shared with [Community Safety Partnerships](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da629596-a79c-4b5e-a718-cdc310316788) (formerly known as Crime and Disorder Reduction Partnerships in England) to reduce community violence.

The requirement for [ACCIDENT AND EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT TYPE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|24aa9723-750c-42e9-a7a3-14dd35df6a34|490403ee-48fd-4693-bed8-912f2759a2b8) '01' to collect the [Information Sharing to Tackle Violence Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|49c64590-d8ba-47ce-8525-d5eb9567fd0d) is considered mandatory .

The requirement for [ACCIDENT AND EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT TYPE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|24aa9723-750c-42e9-a7a3-14dd35df6a34|490403ee-48fd-4693-bed8-912f2759a2b8) '02', '03' and '04' to collect the [Information Sharing to Tackle Violence Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|49c64590-d8ba-47ce-8525-d5eb9567fd0d) is considered optional .

The frequency of reporting the [Information Sharing to Tackle Violence Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|49c64590-d8ba-47ce-8525-d5eb9567fd0d) should be determined locally, but must be at least monthly.

Submission Information:

The [Information Sharing to Tackle Violence Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|49c64590-d8ba-47ce-8525-d5eb9567fd0d) is submitted to a [Community Safety Partnership](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da629596-a79c-4b5e-a718-cdc310316788) using the Information Sharing to Tackle Violence XML Schema.

The XML Schema and Release Notes are available as a downloadable zip file from [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas.

Contact the [Community Safety Partnership](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da629596-a79c-4b5e-a718-cdc310316788) before submitting using the XML Schema.

items.label: Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Data Set
items.description:
The purpose of the [Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Data Set](MC|DM|4bbc08f5-8890-408f-b22a-53a4ff68b25b) is to quantify the number of [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) (aged 16 and over) admitted to hospital, who are risk assessed for Venous Thromboembolism using the [Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Tool](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cf4115fd-a581-4fde-8136-d05a24c5b2ec) to allow appropriate preventative treatment based on guidance from the [National Institute for Health and Care Excellence](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f79e1b0c-250a-4f67-b706-e4a97ec1a753) ([NICE](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f79e1b0c-250a-4f67-b706-e4a97ec1a753)).

Collection and submission:

All providers of NHS funded acute hospital care (including [NHS Foundation Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195) and [Independent Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|947e6213-7b28-428f-82e5-a873d0d5da31) of acute NHS services) must complete this data collection.

Data on Venous Thromboembolism risk assessments is uploaded onto the [Strategic Data Collection Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|77f0392c-a996-41d1-b528-3d8d56a18408) ([SDCS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|77f0392c-a996-41d1-b528-3d8d56a18408)) each month no later than 20 working days after the month end. Revisions to the data set before the cut off date are allowed, however revisions made after the cut off date must be made in liaison with [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc).

Further guidance:

For further guidance on the [Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Data Set](MC|DM|4bbc08f5-8890-408f-b22a-53a4ff68b25b), see the:

  • [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) website at Venous thromboembolism (VTE) risk assessment
  • [National Institute for Health and Care Excellence](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f79e1b0c-250a-4f67-b706-e4a97ec1a753) website at Venous thromboembolism - reducing the risk.

items.label: ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST CDS TYPE 040 - END OF PERIOD CENSUS (OLD)
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: NHS Breast Screening Programme Central Return Data Set (KC63)
items.description:
The [NHS Breast Screening Programme Central Return Data Set (KC63)](MC|DM|4e71e312-3dfa-45d4-85bb-3d677fbf864f) provides information to the [NHS Breast Screening Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|215b2795-43da-436a-8769-9297f8a75b84) from Upper Tier [Local Authorities](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9b583b07-94d9-47e4-ab20-9d4b17b87906) on the [Breast Screening](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|215b2795-43da-436a-8769-9297f8a75b84) history of their residents.  [Screening Programmes](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e4ebcb97-d550-4b5b-bd85-a8610b3e7955) are supported by the [UK National Screening Committee](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|368b89a0-39e0-4fad-a79b-514dc70d9d74).

The information is used to:

  • assess coverage of [Breast Screening](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|215b2795-43da-436a-8769-9297f8a75b84) and monitor standards of the [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) provided
  • monitor progress towards achieving the Government's objective of reducing the death rate in the population invited for [Breast Screening](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|215b2795-43da-436a-8769-9297f8a75b84)
  • provide data for the Public Expenditure Survey (PES) negotiations, resource allocation to the NHS and Departmental accountability
  • provide data published annually by the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) in the statistical Bulletin 'Breast Screening Programme'.

Collection

Data on [Breast Screening](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|215b2795-43da-436a-8769-9297f8a75b84) should be readily available from the Primary Care Organisation's computerised call and recall system designed for [Breast Screening](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|215b2795-43da-436a-8769-9297f8a75b84).  A national computer program is provided and maintained by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23). 

The [NHS Breast Screening Programme Central Return Data Set (KC63)](MC|DM|4e71e312-3dfa-45d4-85bb-3d677fbf864f) reports information on the [Breast Screening](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|215b2795-43da-436a-8769-9297f8a75b84) history of women who were resident in the Upper Tier [Local Authority](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9b583b07-94d9-47e4-ab20-9d4b17b87906), including Unitary [Local Authorities](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9b583b07-94d9-47e4-ab20-9d4b17b87906) at 31 March. It is completed annually and submitted by the end of the October following the end of the [REPORTING PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|b5f965ea-f3f6-4c01-b6fe-0cb8ef9f063c) to which the data relates.

Submission

The [NHS Breast Screening Programme Central Return Data Set (KC63)](MC|DM|4e71e312-3dfa-45d4-85bb-3d677fbf864f) is submitted in csv file format.

items.label: GPES - Asset - Logical1
items.description:
Coronavirus (COVID-19) has led to increased demand on general practices, including an increasing number of requests to provide patient data to inform planning and support vital research on the cause, effects, treatments and outcomes for patients of the virus.  

To support the response to the coronavirus outbreak, NHS Digital has been legally directed to collect and analyse healthcare information about patients, including from their GP record, for the duration of the coronavirus emergency period, under the COVID-19 Public Health Directions 2020 (COVID-19 Direction). All GP practices in England are legally required to share data with NHS Digital for this purpose under the Health and Social Care Act 2012. More information about this requirement is contained in the Data Provision Notice issued by NHS Digital to GP practices.

This collection will reduce burden on general practices, allowing them to focus on patient care and support the coronavirus response.
items.author: Katherine Salt

items.label: Mothers Sexual Health and Infectious Diseases Data Set
ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST CDS TYPE 090 - EVENT DURING PERIOD (AVAILABLE UNAVAILABLE)
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - CDS Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Type and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 011 - Emergency Care Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|bcd3b1f8-c6c0-4747-9ed1-8ecaddcb6b34).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows. All [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) using the Commissioning Data Set Bulk Replacement Update Mechanism of the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol must begin with this Mandatory Data Group.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
    [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
    [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|0ca039a8-450a-4343-ac86-bf443239bad3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|0981ec8d-16b0-491b-9475-959ecbabc84f) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2-1 TYPE 005B - TRANSACTION HEADER GROUP - BULK UPDATE PROTOCOL
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To carry Commissioning Data Set identification and addressing data and other data indicating the specific use of one of the Update Mechanisms of the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60)
One per Commissioning Data Set record submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 050 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (New) CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 050 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (New) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|574f59fa-19e8-40ab-a925-9c76be0f0d73) is used to report to a new Commissioner an [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) that had previously been the responsibility of another Commissioner.

This [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) should be sent within one month of the end of the period to which it relates unless a shorter time-scale has been agreed with the recipient.

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 050 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (New) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|574f59fa-19e8-40ab-a925-9c76be0f0d73) is shown below.

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Gynaecological
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 020 - Outpatient CDS
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2 Type 020 - Outpatient Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|57e8a7ee-fe5a-41ca-b729-15bde19aa974) carries the data for an Outpatient Attendance or a cancelled/missed [APPOINTMENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|970d415b-4a3d-4708-a2b1-4dc9b76d3653).

It covers all NHS and private Outpatient [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place in any:

  • acute, community, mental health [NHS Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) or [NHS Foundation Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195)
  • other NHS hospital
  • non-NHS hospitals or institutions where the care delivered is NHS-funded.

under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.  

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow, unless the [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) falls under the [Allied Health Professional Referral To Treatment Measurement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7617bfbd-38c7-4086-9486-529a5288a38a) standard.  In this case, an out-patient record for the Allied Health Professional [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) must be submitted, with the CDS DATA GROUP : PATIENT PATHWAY data elements completed as necessary.

Where the Outpatient data relates to a [Referral To Treatment Period Included In Referral To Treatment Consultant-Led Waiting Times Measurement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a9f64c7f-96ee-48f1-8199-cb614334d8de), the CDS DATA GROUP : PATIENT PATHWAY data elements must be completed where appropriate.

This [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) may also be used to submit Referral To Treatment Clock Stop Administrative Events.

This [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) must not be used for "Future Outpatients" - for this the [CDS V6-2 Type 021 - Future Outpatient Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|1112c962-fe3a-4ce9-b30c-1f1b22bc92b4) must be used.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction. 

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 020 - Outpatient Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|57e8a7ee-fe5a-41ca-b729-15bde19aa974) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set
items.description:
Introduction

The purpose of the [Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d) ([DrPLCM](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d)) is to enable the interchange, in a uniform format, of monthly [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level drug [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) data between all purchasers and [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c). This will ensure that  drug [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) and reporting is consistent, comparable and fit for purpose across all commissioning [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The [Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d) is a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level report containing [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) identifiers relating to high cost (National Tariff-excluded) drugs. Its purpose is to substantiate and provide detail to the aggregate information contained within the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) ([ACM](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5)).

Scope

The scope of the [Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d) is all NHS-funded [PRESCRIBED ITEMS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|cba28e40-bd67-4e3f-9a54-32c9994a204c) not reimbursed through [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e), as defined by the [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e) [High Cost Tariff Excluded Drugs](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4b460c62-002a-457e-b71a-9bc618360ced) list, provided to [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) for all NHS commissioners.

This covers:

  • All acute and community NHS and [Independent Sector Healthcare Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6731416e-8a17-4939-a8ba-152810150e08) secondary [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c), but not primary care, from whom the NHS commissions healthcare;
  • All NHS commissioners ([Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) or their equivalents and [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d)).

Note that the totality of expenditure in the [Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d) must be equivalent to the aggregate monetary value shown relating to [High Cost Tariff Excluded Drugs](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4b460c62-002a-457e-b71a-9bc618360ced) in the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5).

Submission

The [Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d) is required to be submitted on a monthly basis to the respective [Data Services for Commissioners Regional Office](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6e84f24b-1f3e-4f4b-8eac-eb02d9d881ec) ([DSCRO](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6e84f24b-1f3e-4f4b-8eac-eb02d9d881ec)) as nominated by each commissioning function in line with the dates documented in the data submission timetable within Schedule 6 of the [NHS Standard Contract](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|519b41dd-a19e-4f8e-90be-7554ed54f492).

The completed monthly [Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d) should be transmitted using the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) [Data Landing Portal](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|06c07147-5469-4af3-b713-c0a5cbbbef0e) ([DLP](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|06c07147-5469-4af3-b713-c0a5cbbbef0e)).

For further information on the [Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d), see the [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) website at: Directly Commissioned Services Reporting Requirements.

items.label: TRUD: Commissioning Data Set 6-2-1 (Emergency Care)
items.description:
NHS Data Model and Dictionary Service:
Commissioning Data Set Version 6-2-1 (Emergency Care)
The Information Standard was approved by the Standardisation Committee for Care Information, as Commissioning Data Sets: Emergency Care Data Set.

During testing it was discovered that the original XML schema supporting CDS version 6-2-1 omitted the Net Delete Element which allows deletion of a record using the net change CDS Submission Protocol. A new version of the CDS XML schema V6-2-1 has been released to replace the original.


Future Release:

The future version of the Commissioning Data Set Data Set XML Schema is:


- Version: 6-2-1

- Available From: 01/10/2017

- Useable To:


Please note the new version (CDS V6-2-1) can be downloaded but should not be used until 01 October 2017 unless you are an early adopter.

items.label: Stop Smoking Services Quarterly Data Set
items.description:
The [Stop Smoking Services Quarterly Data Set](MC|DM|5e61fee8-2526-497e-85a0-e6ecf1e47a17) is used to monitor and evaluate the effectiveness and coverage of [Stop Smoking Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8e5c36b7-6887-4dc7-8c8c-25d3e2d755d4). It is designed to provide consistent information on people who have sought and received quitting help from an evidence-based service.

Collection and Submission

The [Stop Smoking Services Quarterly Data Set](MC|DM|5e61fee8-2526-497e-85a0-e6ecf1e47a17) is required by [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) and is collected from [Local Authorities](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9b583b07-94d9-47e4-ab20-9d4b17b87906).

The [Stop Smoking Services Quarterly Data Set](MC|DM|5e61fee8-2526-497e-85a0-e6ecf1e47a17) relates to [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place over a 3 month period and should be submitted by the thirty second working day after the end of the quarter to which it relates.

The [Stop Smoking Services Quarterly Data Set](MC|DM|5e61fee8-2526-497e-85a0-e6ecf1e47a17) is transmitted at aggregate level to the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) [Strategic Data Collection Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|77f0392c-a996-41d1-b528-3d8d56a18408) ([SDCS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|77f0392c-a996-41d1-b528-3d8d56a18408)) available at NHS Stop Smoking Services Collection.

Further guidance

Further information on the NHS [Stop Smoking Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8e5c36b7-6887-4dc7-8c8c-25d3e2d755d4) and the monitoring guidance can be found on the [National Centre for Smoking Cessation and Training](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|90618f79-d64e-4ba7-9c3a-e79ca152e897) website at Local Stop Smoking Services: Service and Delivery Guidance 2014.

items.label: NHS Continuing Healthcare Quarterly Central Return Data Set
CDS V6-2 Type 170 - Admitted Patient Care - Detained and or Long Term Psychiatric Census CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 170 - Admitted Patient Care - Detained and or Long Term Psychiatric Census Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6381659c-489b-4ad0-a436-6e57b38be042) carries the data for the Psychiatric Census.

The [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) require a record for every [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) admitted as at 31 March each year for which the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) is detained or the Episode is part of a [Hospital Provider Spell](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|bd2616d2-18bb-42be-9d18-2b55c2e002b0) which has lasted longer than one year and for which the majority of time has been spent under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0) in one of the psychiatric specialties.

In the case of Organisation_Mergers and demergers occurring, where the [Hospital Provider Spell](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|bd2616d2-18bb-42be-9d18-2b55c2e002b0) would have lasted longer than one year except for the merger / demerger, [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) should be included. The [ORGANISATION CODE (CODE OF PROVIDER)](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|4bb4554f-8e7d-4340-b6d3-700e8d0d509c|d4e6e08a-9b21-4450-ac2e-4b040aeabe32) will be that of the [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) in existence as at the 31 March Census Date.

[Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) may, by local agreement, make submissions of the Psychiatric Census other than at 31st March each year. Care must be taken to ensure that the [CDS ACTIVITY DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|de0def73-2435-44f4-a825-2e823cc40c88|88ee37cf-83f9-4eb6-b2f1-4bbcedff0511) chosen is compatible with the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol used.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 170 - Admitted Patient Care - Detained and or Long Term Psychiatric Census Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6381659c-489b-4ad0-a436-6e57b38be042) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: NNRD: National Neonatal Research Database

Electronic health records for all neonatal unit admissions across England, Scotland and Wales as specified in the national Neonatal Data Set. 
Data requests can be made with the Neonatal Data Analysis Unit (NDAU). Patient level data can only be supplied when anonymised unless special permission is obtained from the Confidential Advisory Group.

items.label: HES - CDS Data items cross referenced by HES Name - Table 1
Maternity Services Data Set
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) ([null](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec)) is a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)-level data set that captures key information at each stage of the maternity care pathway including mothers demographics, [Antenatal Booking Appointments](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|de3250c8-deac-4d6b-9c08-e8ce422c1b56), admissions and re-admissions, [Screening Tests](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|60d16656-0788-4f16-a064-3186d45f4051), [Labour and Delivery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|964e8fb6-e7c4-4249-8237-9464272c9ded) along with babys demographics, admissions, diagnoses and [Screening Tests](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|60d16656-0788-4f16-a064-3186d45f4051).

As a secondary uses data set the [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) re-uses clinical and operational data for purposes other than direct [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) care. It defines the data items, definitions and associated value sets extracted or derived from local information systems.

The [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) is designed to meet requirements that resulted from the National Maternity Review, which led to the publication of the Better Births report in February 2016. Better Births highlighted the need for [Maternity Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|94cc707e-39de-4d1f-87ab-7163ffeac145) in England to become safer, more personalised and provide better access to information for pregnant women. The publication of Better Births resulted in the establishment of the Maternity Transformation Programme, and the data set forms part of the Sharing Data and Information workstream of the programme.

Data Collection

The [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) collects information on each stage of care for women as they go through pregnancy.

The [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) [Information Standards Notice](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ddc691e8-1321-476d-ad97-2c65bd2ef997) ([ISN](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ddc691e8-1321-476d-ad97-2c65bd2ef997)) mandates the central flow of administrative and clinical information for secondary uses purposes. The scope of the data set includes all [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by NHS-funded [Maternity Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|94cc707e-39de-4d1f-87ab-7163ffeac145) relating to the mother and baby or babies, from the point of the first [Antenatal Booking Appointment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|de3250c8-deac-4d6b-9c08-e8ce422c1b56) until the mother and baby are discharged from [Maternity Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|94cc707e-39de-4d1f-87ab-7163ffeac145).

The [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) provides the definitions for data:

  • to be lodged in the central data warehouse regularly and routinely e.g. monthly. Extracts will be taken at prearranged intervals for publication
  • to be assembled, compiled and to flow into a secondary uses data warehouse
  • to provide timely, pseudonymised [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)-based data and information for purposes other than direct clinical care, e.g. planning, commissioning, public health, clinical audit, performance improvement, research, clinical governance.

The [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) enables standardised collection of data from various services to be assembled for reporting purposes.

Submission information

The [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) is submitted centrally via the [Data Processing Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46490f3e-e736-4efa-be2a-34e8087377cd) ([DPS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46490f3e-e736-4efa-be2a-34e8087377cd)) maintained by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23).

The [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) is submitted to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) using the [Maternity Services Data Set](MC|DM|66e8426a-87f0-45a8-8e28-4f796129e7ec) XML Schema.

A conversion tool has also been developed which enables the loading or copying of data into the provided table structure. Once populated, the tool can export the data in the required XML format, ready for submission.

Format information

Data for submission will be formatted into an XML file as per [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas.

For enquiries regarding the XML Schema, please contact [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) at enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk.

Further guidance

Further guidance has been produced by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) and is available at Maternity Services Data Set.

items.label: Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Out-Patient Care
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set is used to standardise the method of reporting cost information at [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level. All designated NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) of acute activity are required to submit [Patient Level Information Costing](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46533a5a-17b1-4a64-b31b-e0dc56e90b09) data.

The Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set is used to

  • inform new methods of pricing NHS [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135);
  • inform new approaches and other changes to the design of the currencies used to price NHS [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135);
  • contribute to [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc)'s strategic objective of a single national cost collection by 2020 inform the relationship between provider characteristics and cost;
  • help [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) to maximise use of their resources and improve efficiencies, as required by the provider licence;
  • identify the relationship between [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) characteristics and cost;
  • support an approach to benchmarking for regulatory purposes.

Data Extract Specification

Description

[NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) has mandated designated [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) and [NHS Foundation Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195) to record and report:

  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Admitted Patient Care](MC|DM|a5c5598c-245a-49e6-8368-c9ec998027b3)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Emergency Care](MC|DM|2d53de74-c588-4041-b6e1-d4589b69f22b)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Out-Patient Care](MC|DM|6a89b75d-50b8-4b61-b1b9-efed958b4c80)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Reconciliation](MC|DM|baa8fa6c-4f52-47a4-850c-d0edb78f855d)

Reporting is required at the end of each financial year, consistent with the methodologies and submission processes in the Approved Costing Guidance. This only includes those NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) noted in the Costing Mandation Timetable and does not include non-NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c).

Time

The data is collected annually. It must be submitted in accordance with the timetable set out by [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) in the National Cost Collection Guidance (part of the Approved Costing Guidance).

Format

The data should be submitted in an XML file, created by [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc)'s Data Validation Tool (DVT). Information on how to access and use this tool is included in the National Cost Collection Guidance (part of the Approved Costing Guidance).

Transmission

[Patient Level Information Costing](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46533a5a-17b1-4a64-b31b-e0dc56e90b09) data will be submitted to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) using [Secure Electronic File Transfer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581) ([SEFT](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581)). [Secure Electronic File Transfer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581) ([SEFT](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581)) can only be accessed by registered and approved users and [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) will invite relevant people to register for the service and provide details of the log in process.

items.label: National Joint Registry Data Set - Elbow
items.description:
Background:

The National Joint Registry Data Set collects information on primary [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d) and revision [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d).

The majority of National Joint Registry Data Set items relate to the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s operation details and are collected in the [OPERATING THEATRE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|42a28a46-7b03-452d-be05-6f647fbb9994|b6def954-671e-435e-93cf-b447d1b9310e).

The National Codes for National Joint Registry items match the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) bulk upload codes / system generated codes.

[PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) must give their consent for this data to be recorded on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) Data Entry System (the electronic system for collection and transfer of data). 

Note: the consent is for data in the 'Patient Identifiers' group. Where consent is not given, the 'Patient Details' group and the operation details are still recorded.

Operations included in the National Joint Registry database:

  • [Primary Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4a69cd6c-786e-4980-8735-dcf86ad64eb7)
  • [Revision Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f2f87cd5-7b90-47bb-b9ca-7ba60586c425)
  • [Primary Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7804da41-fec7-41a2-89f3-c946a18aac66)
  • [Revision Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7985d1d9-516c-4be6-9c0a-47806031c91b)
  • [Primary Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|41c4323f-80e5-4b1f-a253-14b75ecb8c8d)
  • [Revision Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|36ba0887-a041-4add-b5b6-5fa914bbfa26)
  • [Primary Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db80b9d1-f233-4e32-a9a5-b2140a7e471a)
  • [Revision Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|266027dd-7765-4754-bbce-1a95eba960ff)

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 090 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Available or Unavailable) CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 090 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Available or Unavailable) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6ee03e4d-2743-4188-8043-f96a094ecafb) is used to report changes in the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s availability for treatment.

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.  

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow. 

Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) are intended for those [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) who have the capability to implement transaction-based processing, and are transmitted using Net Change Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.  They should be supplemented where required by an annual (or other agreed time-cycle) submission of the [CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27).

Note: for Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e), the [CDS UNIQUE IDENTIFIER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|de0def73-2435-44f4-a825-2e823cc40c88|8e343214-7563-4f1d-aa33-65910b696610), as held in the Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group, must be completed in order to provide the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|503f6c7d-2bca-4744-a546-d60892c2b795) identity.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 090 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Available or Unavailable) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6ee03e4d-2743-4188-8043-f96a094ecafb) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 180 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Birth Episode CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 180 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6fab2f94-05e8-4d1a-8cc3-1885f056bcc3) carries the data for an Unfinished Birth Episode.

This is required when a delivery has resulted in a [REGISTRABLE BIRTH](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|44f45a63-0b99-426a-a156-877f0a143854) which has taken place in either an NHS Hospital or in an non-NHS [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) funded by the NHS.

The information is taken from the birth notification for each baby born.

Unfinished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set records are required for all Unfinished Birth Episodes as at midnight on 31st March each year.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 180 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6fab2f94-05e8-4d1a-8cc3-1885f056bcc3) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: National Neonatal Data Set - Two Year Neonatal Outcomes Assessment
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The National Neonatal Data Set consists of a defined list of data items that are extracted from electronic clinical records created by clinical staff on all admissions to Neonatal Critical Care Units in England.

The National Neonatal Data Set is in two parts:

  • The [National Neonatal Data Set - Episodic and Daily Care](MC|DM|985908c3-3dc3-45d2-88bd-f4f910481f05) covers the period of time a baby is cared for in Neonatal Critical Care, Transitional Care, or other non-standard critical care settings
  • The [National Neonatal Data Set - Two Year Neonatal Outcomes Assessment](MC|DM|6fffdb1b-6b8b-4bf9-aa93-484aaaf336cc), carries data relating to a [Two Year Neonatal Outcomes Assessment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee949530-91ce-40d5-a645-2a6f53ee5e57) carried out on the same child approximately two years after their treatment.  The [Two Year Neonatal Outcomes Assessment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee949530-91ce-40d5-a645-2a6f53ee5e57) may be carried out by the same [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) who was responsible for the neonatal [CRITICAL CARE PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|01063210-0542-4aa8-973e-debfbaba354b), or by a different [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The two neonatal data sets comprise data items relating to [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) demographics, [CLINICAL INTERVENTIONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|a9200e74-c982-49ea-8870-ead8ba85a9c7), outcomes, and [PATIENT DIAGNOSES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|b219e010-487b-4ef7-9dcd-a5adea5facca). Each data item is mapped where possible to existing [ISB](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|0bbcf5c9-d82a-4bb1-b70c-8c26006a8154) / [SCCI](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|1602db48-f192-4ca0-945f-6f0a0b0af88a) / [DCB](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|25154bbc-b21d-4d92-b1fc-b1660e413997) [Information Standards and Collections (including Extractions)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|1f93a59d-5dc0-4771-a870-6cedc689345e) (such as the [Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9) and Maternity Services Data Set Version 1) as well as to SNOMED_CT and ICD codes.

The aim of the National Neonatal Data Set is to extract data items from electronic clinical records, create a database of these items, and make this available as a national resource to serve a variety of needs, so avoiding duplicate data collections for different purposes, minimising the burden placed upon clinical teams, and promoting data quality and completeness.

[Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) involved in the collection may choose whether to allow identifiable or unidentifiable (anonymised) information to flow to the [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5fb2d262-ea28-4a48-864c-c106ac47388d).  Where anonymised data is to flow, the appropriate 'withheld' patient and parents demographic structures should be used (i.e. those with no [PERSON IDENTIFIERS](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ce18b430-a99d-4264-b91e-1f1c073ab44d|96b9d703-1f65-487b-b996-8e5cbf30e106), such as [NHS NUMBER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9ac1f4ff-5c7f-4cb5-9537-b9be3496d551|dcb113c8-b687-4e0f-bdbf-c4b180205255) or [PERSON BIRTH DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ce18b430-a99d-4264-b91e-1f1c073ab44d|bb34edf7-7e1a-4f3b-95ae-769b78413560)). 

In addition, where anonymisation is required, the dates and times of events carried throughout the data set (such as [SAMPLE COLLECTION DATE AND TIME](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|6a1ec3b3-afe9-495d-9723-b2fe75301915|73acbd04-1dd1-4324-9c12-6dbb30998c9d), [PROCEDURE DATE AND TIME (ABDOMINAL X-RAY)](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|14666be2-08fc-4a87-9479-fb498d312f38|be748ed1-9656-48c8-b534-fb87ee16ff20)) should be replaced with the specific relevant year and month of the event and the [NUMBER OF MINUTES (BIRTH TO EVENT)](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|039270cd-1ea5-48cb-9864-43791b4996bb|ffcd7d71-4e78-4a36-8e4f-22ca6654855f).  The National Neonatal Data Set structure allows an either/or choice for these event items throughout the data set.

Data Collection

The National Neonatal Data Set consists of a defined list of data items that are extracted from electronic clinical records created by clinical staff relating to all neonatal critical care delivered in England.  The [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5fb2d262-ea28-4a48-864c-c106ac47388d) has established a database, the National Neonatal Research Database (NNRD) to hold data comprising the National Neonatal Data Set, as a national resource.

Submission Information

For submission information, see the NDAU website.  Note that all date and time fields in the National Neonatal Data Set should be in Co-ordinated Universal Time (UTC) for submission purposes.

Further Guidance

Further guidance has been produced by the [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5fb2d262-ea28-4a48-864c-c106ac47388d) and is available on their website at: NDAU website.

items.label: WARD ATTENDANCE CDS TYPE
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.
