items.label: CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - CDS Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Type and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 011 - Emergency Care Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|bcd3b1f8-c6c0-4747-9ed1-8ecaddcb6b34).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows. All [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) using the Commissioning Data Set Net Change Update Mechanism of the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol must begin with this Mandatory Data Group.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
    [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
    [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|0ca039a8-450a-4343-ac86-bf443239bad3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|0981ec8d-16b0-491b-9475-959ecbabc84f) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2-1 TYPE 005N - CDS TRANSACTION HEADER GROUP - NET CHANGE PROTOCOL
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To carry Commissioning Data Set identification and addressing data and other data indicating the specific use of one of the Update Mechanisms of the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6)
One per Commissioning Data Set record submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: Secondary Uses Services
items.description:
Single, comprehensive repository for healthcare data in England which enables a range of reporting and analyses to support the NHS in the delivery of healthcare services. Used primarily by Providers and Commissioners to drive system of payments.
Data covers:
* Finished general episodes admitted patient care
* Outpatients
* A&E attendances.

items.label: Quarterly Monitoring Cancelled Operations Data Set (QMCO)
CDS V6-2 Type 150 - Admitted Patient Care - Other Birth Event CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 150 - Admitted Patient Care - Other Birth Event Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|74e70752-e7ff-4ea3-b5aa-fae280dedbde) carries the data for an Other Birth.

This [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) applies to:
  • NHS funded home births and
  • all other birth events which are not NHS-funded, either directly or under an [NHS SERVICE AGREEMENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|38cc0b58-0a2a-4da6-ad7f-f0347cabcfe1).

The data in these records originates from birth notification records and requires only a limited data set to be completed.

Maternity events, taking place in either NHS hospitals or in non-NHS [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) funded by the NHS, will be recorded using [CDS V6-2 Type 120 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|48a8c2fa-a0ce-469d-b72d-e05176cd907e) and [CDS V6-2 Type 140 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|ad449b19-bd4c-4880-b87e-9afb0d14ca1f).  

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 150 - Admitted Patient Care - Other Birth Event Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|74e70752-e7ff-4ea3-b5aa-fae280dedbde) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2 TYPE 150 - OTHER BIRTH EVENT COMMISSIONING DATA SET
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To support the details of a Finished General Episode.
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|ebf9db2f-875b-4a5f-b32a-0fa27d3bfa93)
One per Interchange submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.
M 1..* DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1)
One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: CDS TRANSACTION HEADER GROUP
Dependent upon the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol being used, one of the following must be used per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457):
[CDS V6-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|08041212-bd87-459b-a1ed-f68488bca030)
Or
[CDS V6-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|1879991f-da27-4e15-b097-43745796fcf0)

items.label: Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set
items.description:
Introduction

The purpose of the [Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5) ([PLCM](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5)) is to enable the interchange, in a uniform format, of monthly [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) data between all purchasers and [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c). This will ensure that [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) and reporting is consistent, comparable and fit for purpose across all commissioning [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The [Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5) is a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level report containing [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) identifiers. Its purpose is to substantiate and provide detail to the information contained within the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) ([ACM](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5)). It will contain details of [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level clinical activities that are not found in flows of standard Commissioning Data Sets (CDS) submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).

Scope

The scope of the [Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5) Information Standard is all NHS-funded acute and community clinical care (excluding drugs and [MEDICAL DEVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|0d6a26cb-cd9e-4960-97aa-40b6b06d7837) not covered by the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e)) provided to [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9), as well as financial adjustments not attributed directly to clinical care, for all commissioners.

This covers:

  • All acute and community NHS and secondary care [Independent Sector Healthcare Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6731416e-8a17-4939-a8ba-152810150e08), but not primary care, from whom the NHS commissions healthcare
  • All NHS commissioners ([Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) ([CCG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db)) or their equivalents and [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d)).

Note that the totality of expenditure in the [Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5) must be equivalent to the monetary value (excluding drugs and [MEDICAL DEVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|0d6a26cb-cd9e-4960-97aa-40b6b06d7837) not covered by the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e)) shown in the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5).

Submission

The [Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5) is submitted on a monthly basis to the respective [Data Services for Commissioners Regional Office](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6e84f24b-1f3e-4f4b-8eac-eb02d9d881ec) ([DSCRO](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6e84f24b-1f3e-4f4b-8eac-eb02d9d881ec)) as nominated by each commissioning function in line with the dates documented in the data submission timetable within Schedule 6 of the [NHS Standard Contract](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|519b41dd-a19e-4f8e-90be-7554ed54f492).

The completed monthly [Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5) should be transmitted using the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) [Data Landing Portal](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|06c07147-5469-4af3-b713-c0a5cbbbef0e) ([DLP](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|06c07147-5469-4af3-b713-c0a5cbbbef0e)).

For further information on the [Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5), see the [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) website at: Directly Commissioned Services Reporting Requirements.

items.label: Inter-Provider Transfer Administrative Minimum Data Set
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The NHS need to measure and monitor the [REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|b96e7117-44c3-4c3c-a6ba-0fa3c2c62473) within [PATIENT PATHWAYS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|4a2e987b-fdd8-4899-9abe-65cd4c0866aa) to ensure that they are progressing as planned to achieve the 18 weeks target.

In an estimated 10% to 20% of cases, responsibility for the [PATIENT PATHWAY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|4a2e987b-fdd8-4899-9abe-65cd4c0866aa) will be transferred between [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c). The receiving [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) would be unable to report on the 18 weeks target for these cases unless the referring [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) supplied the [PATIENT PATHWAY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|4a2e987b-fdd8-4899-9abe-65cd4c0866aa) information at the time of transfer.

This data set specifies the data necessary to permit the receiving [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) to be able to report the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s progress along their [PATIENT PATHWAY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|4a2e987b-fdd8-4899-9abe-65cd4c0866aa) and, in particular, their [REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|b96e7117-44c3-4c3c-a6ba-0fa3c2c62473).

Scope and Collection
  • Completion is mandatory for all [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) with a [REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|b96e7117-44c3-4c3c-a6ba-0fa3c2c62473) where there has been a transfer of care to an alternative [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c).
  • Completion is advisable for [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) without a [REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|b96e7117-44c3-4c3c-a6ba-0fa3c2c62473), where there has been a transfer of care to an alternative [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c), but this is voluntary.
  • The referring [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) should send the data set within 48 hours of [DECISION TO REFER DATE (INTER-PROVIDER TRANSFER)](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|96ea7ed9-5e69-4d8d-aadc-c37a3e3b7318|f7c56f61-d087-411e-bafd-43eefb43df87).
  • Inter-provider transfer [SERVICE REQUESTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|427387c9-b20b-45e5-b2bd-50541bfe296a) for clinical opinion or diagnostics, where the care of the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) remains with the referring [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c), are voluntary.
  • [SERVICE REQUESTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|427387c9-b20b-45e5-b2bd-50541bfe296a) associated with the following [PATIENT PATHWAYS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|4a2e987b-fdd8-4899-9abe-65cd4c0866aa) are also not currently included:
    • Non-elective [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)
    • Planned admissions (usually part of a planned sequence of clinical care determined mainly on social or clinical criteria, for example, a check cystoscopy).

Where the [Inter-Provider Transfer Administrative Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|7b07643f-0693-4c3c-9e75-43f4f5728fac) is sent WITH the clinical referral letter it is considered to be complete if the following key data items are included:

  • [NHS NUMBER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d84008da-1c38-4c38-a5d7-2249d6d57851|945cf11f-c4b8-4a43-9883-af4adc75e8e8)
  • [PATIENT PATHWAY IDENTIFIER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|267763e7-bbe9-4415-b4d9-74556f34fdc4|e68a22ef-a51b-4a07-b28b-dced2ed787e1)
  • [ORGANISATION CODE (PATIENT PATHWAY IDENTIFIER ISSUER)](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|4bb4554f-8e7d-4340-b6d3-700e8d0d509c|87090100-f70d-452a-839a-eb8177bc93e5)
  • [REFERRING ORGANISATION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|bb693bcd-f1c1-4ea0-bccd-c7e4ae73577a|22955378-f555-4b82-b11a-73e4548dd1db)
  • [REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD START DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|bb693bcd-f1c1-4ea0-bccd-c7e4ae73577a|40a9a02c-7948-4147-b7a1-b838ce503d09)
  • [REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIOD STATUS (INTER-PROVIDER TRANSFER)](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|bb693bcd-f1c1-4ea0-bccd-c7e4ae73577a|e496ac9e-8a3b-45aa-8b5f-111e4916f962)

Where the [Inter-Provider Transfer Administrative Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|7b07643f-0693-4c3c-9e75-43f4f5728fac) is sent independently of the clinical referral letter, ALL mandated [Inter-Provider Transfer Administrative Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|7b07643f-0693-4c3c-9e75-43f4f5728fac) data items must be completed.

Further Guidance

Further guidance on the data set can be found in 'The Inter-Provider Transfer Administrative Data Set Operational Information Standard' and in DSCN 30/2007.

Further guidance and definitions on [REFERRAL TO TREATMENT PERIODS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|b96e7117-44c3-4c3c-a6ba-0fa3c2c62473) and those [PATIENT PATHWAYS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|4a2e987b-fdd8-4899-9abe-65cd4c0866aa) included within the Consultant-Led Referral to Treatment Waiting Times can be found on the [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) website at: Consultant-led Referral to Treatment Waiting Times.

items.label: HES - CDS Data items cross referenced by HES Item - Table 2
Head and Neck Cancer Audit (HANA)
items.description:
Description: HANA is the new National Head and Neck Cancer Audit for England and Wales. It aims to improve the quality of services and the outcomes achieved for patients. A team of surgeons, oncologists, dentists, nutritionists, speech and language specialists and cancer audit experts will develop and manage HANA.
HANA will collect information about the diagnosis, management and treatment of every patient newly diagnosed with head and neck cancer, and their outcomes.
The findings from HANA will contribute to changes in clinical practice ensuring that patients receive the best care possible and experience an improved quality of life.

Url: http://headandneckaudit.com
items.author: British Association of Head and Neck Oncologists (BAHNO)
items.organisation: British Association of Head and Neck Oncologists (BAHNO)

items.label: ACCIDENT AND EMERGENCY ATTENDANCE CDS TYPE
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Lung
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - CDS Interchange Header
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Interchange and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 011 - Emergency Care Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|bcd3b1f8-c6c0-4747-9ed1-8ecaddcb6b34).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
    [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - CDS Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|0ca039a8-450a-4343-ac86-bf443239bad3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|0981ec8d-16b0-491b-9475-959ecbabc84f) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3) is shown below.

See Commissioning_Data_Set_Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2-1 TYPE 001 - COMMISSIONING DATA SET INTERCHANGE HEADER
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To define the mandatory identity and addressing information for a Commissioning Data Set Interchange submission.
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3)
One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: Old Version 3 ADMITTED PATIENT CARE CDS TYPE - DELIVERY EPISODE
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 200 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Delivery Episode CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 200 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|834b764b-236f-4087-a2fd-dccbfbdb9f38) carries the data for an Unfinished Delivery Episode.

This may take place in either NHS Hospitals or in non-NHS [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) funded by the NHS. The information is taken from the birth notification for each baby born.

Unfinished Birth and Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set records are required for all Unfinished Birth and Delivery Episodes as at midnight on 31 March each year.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Skin
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 003 - CDS Message Header
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Message and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|ebf9db2f-875b-4a5f-b32a-0fa27d3bfa93) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|08041212-bd87-459b-a1ed-f68488bca030) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|1879991f-da27-4e15-b097-43745796fcf0) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|a5c4a6a0-ed3b-4a2a-b97b-694ecbd3e617) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|9705e684-2ff2-41aa-8e5d-b5c887243a52) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2 TYPE 003 - CDS MESSAGE HEADER
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:

One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set v2.0
items.description:
The Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) Data Set is a patient level, output based, secondary uses data set which aims to deliver robust, comprehensive, nationally consistent, and comparable information for people accessing NHS funded IAPT services located in England.

This national data set has been developed with the IAPT Programme to support service delivery and inform clinical decision-making and encourage improved access to talking therapies for people with common mental health problems such as depression and anxiety disorders.

An ongoing requirement exists to review the data set to ensure the content remains fit for purpose'. The changes included in this Version 2.0 release relate to new government policy initiatives, resolution of issues within the current data collection, and inclusion of other key stakeholder requirements

items.label: Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set - Sarcoma
items.description:
The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is a compiled data set which provides the standard for secondary uses information required to support national cancer registration and associated analysis (at local, regional, national and international level), as well as other national cancer audit programmes

The standard and XML Schema consists of:

  • a set of individual data items, with their definitions
  • the assemblage of data items into discrete data sets
  • the means of flowing the data items
  • compilation of the data items into a reconciled and verified data set.

Additionally, the output supports commissioning and service development through provision of relevant information on service delivery and outcomes.

All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) diagnosed with or receiving cancer treatment in or funded by the NHS in England are covered by the standard. This includes adult and paediatric cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9). The standard applies to all [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) providing [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) within secondary care. It does not apply to general practice [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set covers diseases as defined by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0) ([UKIACR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0)) as described in the User Guide at Appendix A and B.

Unless otherwise specified, the term cancer is used throughout the standard and related documents to cover all conditions registerable by the [United Kingdom and Ireland Association of Cancer Registries](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|021ed507-3a4b-429c-bfad-5d8a0745d7c0).

Submission Information:

Providers of [Cancer Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) are required to provide a monthly return on all cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) using the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

The Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) using the null XML Schema.

While the core and cancer site specific data sets are shown as separate data sets within the NHS Data Model and Dictionary, the null XML Schema integrates each core and cancer site specific set of data elements. Documentation provided on the [Technology Reference Data Update Distribution (TRUD)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51766694-3108-4c02-90c1-f79169d908c1) page at: NHS Data Model and Dictionary: DD XML Schemas gives full details of the specification.

For all diagnoses not covered by a cancer site specific data set, only the Core Data Set should be completed. A full list of diagnoses mapped to the appropriate data set is provided in the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) User Guide.

Pathology:

From January 2016 Pathology [Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) across England were mandated through SCCI1521 17/2014, to collect and return structured pathology using the null XML Schema.

This replaced the current reporting to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) of electronic pathology reports which were then transcribed by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) into the Cancer Registration Reports. This also prevented [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams, for example, [Multidisciplinary Teams](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|14177a4e-fd01-43ae-b4ed-8eec0a8a2daf), Pathway Co-ordinators, duplicating the work, which had been happening as part of their data collection process.

From April 2020, the pathology data can only be collected and submitted using the separate Pathology Data Set and Pathology XML Schema. Pathology data items have been removed from the main Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set.

This allows the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams to concentrate on collecting and reporting all the other clinical data required for the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set and the [Pathologists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6ff25bd9-01a5-4a1b-874e-6fe92c45a598) to collect and report the pathology items. This will reduce the burden of data collection for the [Cancer Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e26f0307-40ee-472b-8ab8-e285666b3cf5) teams and allow for more accurate pathology reporting to be submitted to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c).

There will be no requirement for [Pathology Laboratories](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|deab049e-1168-4d17-a5bd-f554de06eca4) to double report. Once their Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are updated to report in the null XML Schema, all other pathology reporting can cease.

Further Guidance:

Further guidance for submission of the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at Cancer Outcomes and Services Dataset.

items.label: HIV and AIDS Reporting Data Set
items.description:
Background:

The scope of the [HIV and AIDS Reporting Data Set](MC|DM|8eff771b-320d-4e53-a66b-b5ed8ab9b8c8) is all [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) who are diagnosed with Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) and receive HIV care from [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c).

NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) are required to generate the [HIV and AIDS Reporting Data Set](MC|DM|8eff771b-320d-4e53-a66b-b5ed8ab9b8c8).

The [HIV and AIDS Reporting Data Set](MC|DM|8eff771b-320d-4e53-a66b-b5ed8ab9b8c8) is used to:

  • Identify the groups at risk of HIV infection in England
  • Monitor the short and long term clinical outcomes of people living with HIV infection
  • Monitor the effectiveness of the national policies and guidance
  • Adapt and refine interventions, as appropriate.

Secondary analyses of aggregate outputs from the [HIV and AIDS Reporting Data Set](MC|DM|8eff771b-320d-4e53-a66b-b5ed8ab9b8c8) will be used to:

  • Support the commissioning of [HIV Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|bcb75c27-de29-4638-9731-cad26512d290) through collation of data to inform the national HIV outpatient tariff for the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e)
  • Conduct performance management at the [Local Authority](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9b583b07-94d9-47e4-ab20-9d4b17b87906) and national level.

For further information on Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS) and Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), see the [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) part of the gov.uk website.

Time period:

The extract covers one calendar quarter.

Frequency:

The [HIV and AIDS Reporting Data Set](MC|DM|8eff771b-320d-4e53-a66b-b5ed8ab9b8c8) is attendance based and should be submitted quarterly, 2 weeks after the end of the quarter.

Format:

Data for submission will be formatted into an xml file as per the [HIV and AIDS Reporting Data Set](MC|DM|8eff771b-320d-4e53-a66b-b5ed8ab9b8c8) XML Schema.

Transmission:

Submissions should be transmitted to [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) through a secure web portal on the [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) ([PHE](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6)) website, using the [null](MC|DM|8eff771b-320d-4e53-a66b-b5ed8ab9b8c8) Data Set XML Schema.

The web portal enables [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) to submit data files in a secure manner to the HIV and STI Department of [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) across the internet and can be found at HIV & STI web portal.

For further information on the [HIV and AIDS Reporting Data Set](MC|DM|8eff771b-320d-4e53-a66b-b5ed8ab9b8c8), see the [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) part of the gov.uk website at: HIV surveillance systems.

items.label: Patients Detained In Hospital Or On Supervised Community Treatment Data Set (KP90)
CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - CDS Message Trailer
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Message and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 011 - Emergency Care CDS](MC|DM|87087d78-978e-43e8-ac05-f069797422a5).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|a058bac6-ab46-47f7-ab7a-ec5a62c447a6) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|06d5317a-614c-415e-b5c7-26213fd2508f) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) is shown below.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 040 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Old) CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 040 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Old) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|939f6231-9d2e-432a-9dee-31e1a75afe21) is used to report to the previous (old) Commissioner that the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) is now the responsibility of another Commissioner.

This [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) should be sent within one month of the end of the period to which it relates unless a shorter time-scale has been agreed with the recipient.

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 040 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Old) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|939f6231-9d2e-432a-9dee-31e1a75afe21) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 002 - CDS Interchange Trailer
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|9705e684-2ff2-41aa-8e5d-b5c887243a52) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Interchange and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|ebf9db2f-875b-4a5f-b32a-0fa27d3bfa93) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|08041212-bd87-459b-a1ed-f68488bca030) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|1879991f-da27-4e15-b097-43745796fcf0) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|a5c4a6a0-ed3b-4a2a-b97b-694ecbd3e617) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|9705e684-2ff2-41aa-8e5d-b5c887243a52) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|9705e684-2ff2-41aa-8e5d-b5c887243a52) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2 TYPE 002 - CDS INTERCHANGE TRAILER
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To define the mandatory identity and addressing information for a Commissioning Data Set submission .
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|9705e684-2ff2-41aa-8e5d-b5c887243a52)
One per Interchange submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: National Neonatal Data Set - Episodic and Daily Care
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The National Neonatal Data Set consists of a defined list of data items that are extracted from electronic clinical records created by clinical staff on all admissions to Neonatal Critical Care Units in England.

The National Neonatal Data Set is in two parts:

  • The [National Neonatal Data Set - Episodic and Daily Care](MC|DM|985908c3-3dc3-45d2-88bd-f4f910481f05) covers the period of time a baby is cared for in Neonatal Critical Care, Transitional Care, or other non-standard critical care settings
  • The [National Neonatal Data Set - Two Year Neonatal Outcomes Assessment](MC|DM|6fffdb1b-6b8b-4bf9-aa93-484aaaf336cc), carries data relating to a [Two Year Neonatal Outcomes Assessment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee949530-91ce-40d5-a645-2a6f53ee5e57) carried out on the same child approximately two years after their treatment.  The [Two Year Neonatal Outcomes Assessment](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee949530-91ce-40d5-a645-2a6f53ee5e57) may be carried out by the same [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) who was responsible for the neonatal [CRITICAL CARE PERIOD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|01063210-0542-4aa8-973e-debfbaba354b), or by a different [Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The two neonatal data sets comprise data items relating to [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) demographics, [CLINICAL INTERVENTIONS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|a9200e74-c982-49ea-8870-ead8ba85a9c7), outcomes, and [PATIENT DIAGNOSES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|b219e010-487b-4ef7-9dcd-a5adea5facca). Each data item is mapped where possible to existing [ISB](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|0bbcf5c9-d82a-4bb1-b70c-8c26006a8154) / [SCCI](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|1602db48-f192-4ca0-945f-6f0a0b0af88a) / [DCB](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|25154bbc-b21d-4d92-b1fc-b1660e413997) [Information Standards and Collections (including Extractions)](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|1f93a59d-5dc0-4771-a870-6cedc689345e) (such as the [Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9) and Maternity Services Data Set Version 1) as well as to SNOMED_CT and ICD codes.

The aim of the National Neonatal Data Set is to extract data items from electronic clinical records, create a database of these items, and make this available as a national resource to serve a variety of needs, so avoiding duplicate data collections for different purposes, minimising the burden placed upon clinical teams, and promoting data quality and completeness.

[Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) involved in the collection may choose whether to allow identifiable or unidentifiable (anonymised) information to flow to the [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5fb2d262-ea28-4a48-864c-c106ac47388d).  Where anonymised data is to flow, the appropriate 'withheld' patient and parents demographic structures should be used (i.e. those with no [PERSON IDENTIFIERS](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ce18b430-a99d-4264-b91e-1f1c073ab44d|96b9d703-1f65-487b-b996-8e5cbf30e106), such as [NHS NUMBER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9ac1f4ff-5c7f-4cb5-9537-b9be3496d551|dcb113c8-b687-4e0f-bdbf-c4b180205255) or [PERSON BIRTH DATE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ce18b430-a99d-4264-b91e-1f1c073ab44d|bb34edf7-7e1a-4f3b-95ae-769b78413560)). 

In addition, where anonymisation is required, the dates and times of events carried throughout the data set (such as [SAMPLE COLLECTION DATE AND TIME](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|6a1ec3b3-afe9-495d-9723-b2fe75301915|73acbd04-1dd1-4324-9c12-6dbb30998c9d), [PROCEDURE DATE AND TIME (ABDOMINAL X-RAY)](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|14666be2-08fc-4a87-9479-fb498d312f38|be748ed1-9656-48c8-b534-fb87ee16ff20)) should be replaced with the specific relevant year and month of the event and the [NUMBER OF MINUTES (BIRTH TO EVENT)](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|039270cd-1ea5-48cb-9864-43791b4996bb|ffcd7d71-4e78-4a36-8e4f-22ca6654855f).  The National Neonatal Data Set structure allows an either/or choice for these event items throughout the data set.

Data Collection

The National Neonatal Data Set consists of a defined list of data items that are extracted from electronic clinical records created by clinical staff relating to all neonatal critical care delivered in England.  The [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5fb2d262-ea28-4a48-864c-c106ac47388d) has established a database, the National Neonatal Research Database (NNRD) to hold data comprising the National Neonatal Data Set, as a national resource.

Submission Information

For submission information, see the NDAU website.  Note that all date and time fields in the National Neonatal Data Set should be in Co-ordinated Universal Time (UTC) for submission purposes.

Further Guidance

Further guidance has been produced by the [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5fb2d262-ea28-4a48-864c-c106ac47388d) and is available on their website at: NDAU website.

items.label: ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST CDS TYPE 080 - EVENT DURING PERIOD (OFFER)
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: National Workforce Data Set
items.description:
The [National Workforce Data Set](MC|DM|9baa76c7-69f6-4366-903b-d45d76eef19e) (NWD) is a reference Data Set comprising standardised definitions to facilitate the capture of nationally consistent information relating to the NHS and wider healthcare workforce.  [National Workforce](MC|DM|9baa76c7-69f6-4366-903b-d45d76eef19e) data items and definitions support a variety of workforce based collections. They are also embedded within operational HR/workforce systems including [Electronic Staff Record](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|1697ca5d-8fd2-4acb-a15a-5f868135c2c1) ([ESR](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|1697ca5d-8fd2-4acb-a15a-5f868135c2c1)), and the NHS Jobs web system.

The [National Workforce Data Set](MC|DM|9baa76c7-69f6-4366-903b-d45d76eef19e) provides common definitions for those data items that are needed to support workforce planning for the NHS workforce and is intended as a reference with an agreed set of data definitions for people who plan workforce at strategic, national and local level.

The changing nature of the provision of NHS funded care is leading to plurality of supply, and therefore a [National Workforce Data Set](MC|DM|9baa76c7-69f6-4366-903b-d45d76eef19e) ensures that all suppliers of NHS care provide workforce information in an agreed and pre-determined format. This provides a practical means for the consistent collection of this information from all providers of NHS funded care to enable comprehensive Healthcare Workforce planning going forwards.

The information captured using the values defined in the [National Workforce Data Set](MC|DM|9baa76c7-69f6-4366-903b-d45d76eef19e) will also be used locally within [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) by a range of people in addition to those mentioned above, such as in Training and Development, Workforce Information and Planning and Equality and Diversity.  The accuracy and relevance of the data captured using the [National Workforce Data Set](MC|DM|9baa76c7-69f6-4366-903b-d45d76eef19e) values will therefore impact on a number of issues at local level and beyond.

Further guidance has been produced by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) and is available on their website at: National Workforce Data Set (NWD) and NHS occupation codes.
