items.label: CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - CDS Interchange Header
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|a058bac6-ab46-47f7-ab7a-ec5a62c447a6) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Interchange and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|a058bac6-ab46-47f7-ab7a-ec5a62c447a6) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 011 - Emergency Care Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|87087d78-978e-43e8-ac05-f069797422a5).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|a058bac6-ab46-47f7-ab7a-ec5a62c447a6) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|42789e1f-3f5d-4965-a41c-6e3207dccc81) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|06d5317a-614c-415e-b5c7-26213fd2508f) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
    [CDS V6-2-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|06baa15c-d440-447a-96cf-c845d947ef94) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|90349669-0790-4d8d-84f2-1f965090574c) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|3383e8d6-837e-4a27-ae09-9b21450a73b2) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|a058bac6-ab46-47f7-ab7a-ec5a62c447a6) is shown below.

See Commissioning_Data_Set_Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 004 - CDS Message Trailer
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|a5c4a6a0-ed3b-4a2a-b97b-694ecbd3e617) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Message and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|ebf9db2f-875b-4a5f-b32a-0fa27d3bfa93) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|08041212-bd87-459b-a1ed-f68488bca030) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|1879991f-da27-4e15-b097-43745796fcf0) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|a5c4a6a0-ed3b-4a2a-b97b-694ecbd3e617) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Each Commissioning Data Set Interchange ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|9705e684-2ff2-41aa-8e5d-b5c887243a52) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|a5c4a6a0-ed3b-4a2a-b97b-694ecbd3e617) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2 TYPE 004 - COMMISSIONING DATA SET MESSAGE TRAILER
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To define the mandatory identity and addressing information for a Commissioning Data Set submission .
M 1..* DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|a5c4a6a0-ed3b-4a2a-b97b-694ecbd3e617)
One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Admitted Patient Care
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set is used to standardise the method of reporting cost information at [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level. All designated NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) of acute activity are required to submit [Patient Level Information Costing](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46533a5a-17b1-4a64-b31b-e0dc56e90b09) data.

The Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set is used to

  • inform new methods of pricing NHS [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135);
  • inform new approaches and other changes to the design of the currencies used to price NHS [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135);
  • contribute to [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc)'s strategic objective of a single national cost collection by 2020 inform the relationship between provider characteristics and cost;
  • help [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) to maximise use of their resources and improve efficiencies, as required by the provider licence;
  • identify the relationship between [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) characteristics and cost;
  • support an approach to benchmarking for regulatory purposes.

Data Extract Specification

Description

[NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) has mandated designated [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) and [NHS Foundation Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195) to record and report:

  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Admitted Patient Care](MC|DM|a5c5598c-245a-49e6-8368-c9ec998027b3)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Emergency Care](MC|DM|2d53de74-c588-4041-b6e1-d4589b69f22b)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Out-Patient Care](MC|DM|6a89b75d-50b8-4b61-b1b9-efed958b4c80)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Reconciliation](MC|DM|baa8fa6c-4f52-47a4-850c-d0edb78f855d)

Reporting is required at the end of each financial year, consistent with the methodologies and submission processes in the Approved Costing Guidance. This only includes those NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) noted in the Costing Mandation Timetable and does not include non-NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c).

Time

The data is collected annually. It must be submitted in accordance with the timetable set out by [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) in the National Cost Collection Guidance (part of the Approved Costing Guidance).

Format

The data should be submitted in an XML file, created by [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc)'s Data Validation Tool (DVT). Information on how to access and use this tool is included in the National Cost Collection Guidance (part of the Approved Costing Guidance).

Transmission

[Patient Level Information Costing](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46533a5a-17b1-4a64-b31b-e0dc56e90b09) data will be submitted to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) using [Secure Electronic File Transfer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581) ([SEFT](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581)). [Secure Electronic File Transfer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581) ([SEFT](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581)) can only be accessed by registered and approved users and [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) will invite relevant people to register for the service and provide details of the log in process.

items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 070 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Remove) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|abc53f78-65f4-4870-a06b-080c6d8dad8a) is used to report that the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) has been removed from the [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c)'s [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|503f6c7d-2bca-4744-a546-d60892c2b795).

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists. 

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) are intended for those [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) who have the capability to implement transaction-based processing, and are transmitted using Net Change Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.  They should be supplemented where required by an annual (or other agreed time-cycle) submission of the [CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27).

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

Where the Care Activity data relates to a [Referral To Treatment Period Included In Referral To Treatment Consultant-Led Waiting Times Measurement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a9f64c7f-96ee-48f1-8199-cb614334d8de), the CDS DATA GROUP : PATIENT PATHWAY data elements must be completed where appropriate.

Note: for Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e), the [CDS UNIQUE IDENTIFIER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|de0def73-2435-44f4-a825-2e823cc40c88|8e343214-7563-4f1d-aa33-65910b696610), as held in the Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group, must be completed in order to provide the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|503f6c7d-2bca-4744-a546-d60892c2b795) identity.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 070 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Remove) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|abc53f78-65f4-4870-a06b-080c6d8dad8a) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 140 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Delivery Episode CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 140 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|ad449b19-bd4c-4880-b87e-9afb0d14ca1f) carries the data for a Finished Delivery Episode which is required when a delivery has resulted in a [REGISTRABLE BIRTH](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|469ebb6e-5d54-4f81-8635-0b4da79c63bb|44f45a63-0b99-426a-a156-877f0a143854).

This may take place in either NHS Hospitals or in non-NHS [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) funded by the NHS. The information is taken from the birth notification for each baby born.

In addition to Finished Delivery Episodes, Unfinished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set records are required for all Unfinished Delivery Episodes as at midnight on 31 March each year.

[CDS V6-2 Type 200 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|834b764b-236f-4087-a2fd-dccbfbdb9f38) should be used for the submission of this Unfinished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.
Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 140 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|ad449b19-bd4c-4880-b87e-9afb0d14ca1f) is shown below.

items.label: CDS MESSAGE HEADER
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: National Minimum Data Set for Thoracic Surgery and Lung Cancer Surgery
items.description:
Presented to SCTS 2004 and at subsequent meetings of the Thoracic Surgical Forum with a mandate to continue the project.

The Ground Rules and Guiding Principles
The data can be collected 
-	within a Dendrite environment
-	or on Tomcat
-	or by any suitable local arrangement
-	or onto an Excel spread sheet (as supplied herewith) 
-	or configured as an Access database locally. 

A hospital IT system should enable users to capture case numbers and dates of birth, admission, procedure and discharge without double entry. 

There will be great advantages in using a user-friendly front end such as Dendrite because the straight listing in the spread sheet is potentially confusing.  However any practiced data handler will find the spread sheet approach easy to deal with once the fields are understood.

The "unit of entry" is an operative episode but this may include more than one procedure. Thus if the patient has any combination of 
-	bronchoscopy/mediastinoscopy/lung resection
-	VATS/thoracotomy
the individual procedures are recorded and can be retrieved but are within the operative episode.

Most entries will be "1" for the item if applicable (e.g. lobectomy done as a named operation, steroid therapy, PET scan carried out).  There is no need for "0" or "N".
Numeric values (e.g. % predicted FEV1, weight) should be entered directly. If a date is required enter DDMMYYYY.

Url: https://scts.org
items.author: Richard Page, Consultant Thoracic Surgeon. Liverpool Heart and Chest Hospital
items.organisation: Society for Cardiothoracic Surgery in Great Britain and Ireland

items.label: AIDC for Patient Identification Data Set
items.description:
The purpose of the [Automatic Identification and Data Capture for Patient Identification Data Set](MC|DM|b5fbd7ab-0a8b-45e6-b55e-b49dea57ce5b) is to support the accurate, timely and, therefore, safer identification of NHS [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) in England, by encoding the key [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) identifiers into a [GS1](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|2d3c9bd8-f057-44c0-b04c-d5b98b195363) DataMatrix 2D barcode which is printed on the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) identity band.

Implementation of this Information Standard enables subsequent processes involving the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) and care provided to the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) (where these processes are also uniquely identified and barcoded) to be automatically identified using [Automatic Identification and Data Capture](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|74035709-2995-476e-b94d-d399895cfe5f) ([AIDC](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|74035709-2995-476e-b94d-d399895cfe5f)) techniques, e.g. bed management, phlebotomy, theatre management and medications administration.

The [Automatic Identification and Data Capture for Patient Identification Data Set](MC|DM|b5fbd7ab-0a8b-45e6-b55e-b49dea57ce5b) provides an agreed national standard for how to encode a GS1 DataMatrix with the key [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) identifiers on the identity wristband and covers production, printing and verification rules for the barcode.

Further guidance can be found on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: DCB1077: AIDC for Patient Identification.

items.label: Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Reconciliation
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set is used to standardise the method of reporting cost information at [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level. All designated NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) of acute activity are required to submit [Patient Level Information Costing](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46533a5a-17b1-4a64-b31b-e0dc56e90b09) data.

The Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set is used to

  • inform new methods of pricing NHS [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135);
  • inform new approaches and other changes to the design of the currencies used to price NHS [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135);
  • contribute to [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc)'s strategic objective of a single national cost collection by 2020 inform the relationship between provider characteristics and cost;
  • help [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) to maximise use of their resources and improve efficiencies, as required by the provider licence;
  • identify the relationship between [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) characteristics and cost;
  • support an approach to benchmarking for regulatory purposes.

Data Extract Specification

Description

[NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) has mandated designated [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|59bf18fd-2c3f-4a6a-8e40-a485fd1ef396) and [NHS Foundation Trust](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|ee047e04-b896-4b46-81d0-7e37e0854195) to record and report:

  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Admitted Patient Care](MC|DM|a5c5598c-245a-49e6-8368-c9ec998027b3)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Emergency Care](MC|DM|2d53de74-c588-4041-b6e1-d4589b69f22b)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Out-Patient Care](MC|DM|6a89b75d-50b8-4b61-b1b9-efed958b4c80)
  • [Patient Level Information Costing System Acute Data Set - Reconciliation](MC|DM|baa8fa6c-4f52-47a4-850c-d0edb78f855d)

Reporting is required at the end of each financial year, consistent with the methodologies and submission processes in the Approved Costing Guidance. This only includes those NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) noted in the Costing Mandation Timetable and does not include non-NHS [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c).

Time

The data is collected annually. It must be submitted in accordance with the timetable set out by [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) in the National Cost Collection Guidance (part of the Approved Costing Guidance).

Format

The data should be submitted in an XML file, created by [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc)'s Data Validation Tool (DVT). Information on how to access and use this tool is included in the National Cost Collection Guidance (part of the Approved Costing Guidance).

Transmission

[Patient Level Information Costing](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|46533a5a-17b1-4a64-b31b-e0dc56e90b09) data will be submitted to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) using [Secure Electronic File Transfer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581) ([SEFT](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581)). [Secure Electronic File Transfer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581) ([SEFT](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c8b4adcd-d110-4816-aab7-719a19090581)) can only be accessed by registered and approved users and [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) will invite relevant people to register for the service and provide details of the log in process.

items.description:
[CDS V6-2-1 Type 011 - Emergency Care Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|bcd3b1f8-c6c0-4747-9ed1-8ecaddcb6b34) carries the data for an [Emergency Care Attendance](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|b3e70eb0-5acf-424c-99b3-4d0faaabcf2e).

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 011 - Emergency Care Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|bcd3b1f8-c6c0-4747-9ed1-8ecaddcb6b34) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To support the details of an Emergency Care Attendance.

items.label: ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST CDS TYPE 110 - EVENT DURING PERIOD (NEW SERVICE AGREEMENT)
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services Secondary Uses Data Set
Diagnostic Imaging Dataset
items.description:
Central collection of detailed information about diagnostic imaging tests carried out on NHS patients (such as x-rays and MRI scans).  Any organisation providing diagnostic imaging tests to NHS patients in England, i.e.:
* NHS (Foundation) trusts / hospitals
* NHS-funded activity with independent sector providers
NOT included are breast screening services or any other diagnostic imaging tests not typically recorded on the local provider's Radiology Information Systems.
Diagnostic Imaging Dataset (DID) does not store the images themselves, or the outcomes/diagnoses related to these images.

items.label: HES: Admitted Patient Care
items.description:
A data set within the Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) warehouse containing records of all patients admitted to NHS hospitals in England.  It contains details of every hospital stay in:
* English NHS hospitals and 
* English NHS commissioned activity in the independent sector.

items.label: Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set
items.description:
Introduction

The [Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9) ([NCCMDS](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9)) provides a record of what happens to a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) when they receive Neonatal Critical Care in a Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, Maternity [WARD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ddbf9ee6-2fcd-4b2b-b073-16c0514bc527|8b80e7fc-0349-4ce4-836c-50bd712d51ac), or Neonatal Transitional Care [WARD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ddbf9ee6-2fcd-4b2b-b073-16c0514bc527|8b80e7fc-0349-4ce4-836c-50bd712d51ac).

The primary purpose of the [Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9) is to allow the operation of the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e) within neonatal critical care. The [Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9) supports the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e) by capturing the data needed to generate a [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) for each calendar day (or part thereof) of a period of neonatal critical care; these [Healthcare Resource Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) are then used to inform the annual aggregate costing exercise, NHS Reference Costs.

Scope and Uses

The scope of the [Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9) is:

a) All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) on a [WARD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ddbf9ee6-2fcd-4b2b-b073-16c0514bc527|8b80e7fc-0349-4ce4-836c-50bd712d51ac) with a [CRITICAL CARE UNIT FUNCTION](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|09a981d8-e09b-4539-a98a-b566fdd76c06|72e9c498-36b6-4c0c-9ca6-fcb191881170) of National Code '13 - Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (Neonatal critical care patients predominate)'.

b) All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) (excluding Mothers) on a [WARD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ddbf9ee6-2fcd-4b2b-b073-16c0514bc527|8b80e7fc-0349-4ce4-836c-50bd712d51ac) with a [CRITICAL CARE UNIT FUNCTION](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|09a981d8-e09b-4539-a98a-b566fdd76c06|72e9c498-36b6-4c0c-9ca6-fcb191881170) of National Code:

  • 14 - Facility for Babies on a Neonatal Transitional Care Ward
  • 15 - Facility for Babies on a Maternity Ward

to whom one or more of the following [CRITICAL CARE ACTIVITY CODES](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|09a981d8-e09b-4539-a98a-b566fdd76c06|3b6afa7e-9744-49ea-b40c-5cc033aa61f7) applies for a period greater than 4 hours:

01 Respiratory support via a tracheal tube (Respiratory support via a tracheal tube provided)
02 Nasal Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (nCPAP) ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving nCPAP for any part of the day)
04 Exchange Transfusion ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) received exchange transfusion)
05 Peritoneal Dialysis ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) received Peritoneal Dialysis)
06 Continuous infusion of inotrope, pulmonary vasodilator or prostaglandin ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) received a continuous infusion of an inotrope, vasodilator (includes pulmonary vasodilators) or prostaglandin)
07 Parenteral Nutrition ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving Parenteral Nutrition (amino acids +/- lipids))
08 Convulsions ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) having convulsions requiring treatment)
09 Oxygen Therapy ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving additional oxygen)
10 Neonatal abstinence syndrome ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving drug treatment for neonatal abstinence (withdrawal) syndrome)
11 Care of an intra-arterial catheter or chest drain ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving care of an intra-arterial catheter or chest drain)
12 Dilution Exchange Transfusion ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) received Dilution Exchange Transfusion)
13 Tracheostomy cared for by nursing staff ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving care of tracheostomy cared for by nursing staff not by an external [Carer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e0ad12cd-4cd0-4c85-a0d4-4ec419afd7e7) (e.g. parent))
14 Tracheostomy cared for by external [Carer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e0ad12cd-4cd0-4c85-a0d4-4ec419afd7e7) ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving care of tracheostomy cared for by an external [Carer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e0ad12cd-4cd0-4c85-a0d4-4ec419afd7e7) (e.g. parent) not by a [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518))
15 Recurrent apnoea ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has recurrent apnoea needing frequent intervention, i.e. over 5 stimulations in 8 hours, or resuscitation with IPPV two or more times in 24 hours)
16 Haemofiltration ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) received Haemofiltration)
22 Continuous monitoring ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) requiring continuous monitoring (by mechanical monitoring equipment) of respiration or heart rate, or by transcutaneous transducers or by Saturation Monitors. Note: apnoea alarms and monitors are excluded as forms of continuous monitoring)
23 Intravenous glucose and electrolyte solutions ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) being given intravenous glucose and electrolyte solutions)
24 Tube-fed ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) being tube-fed)
25 Barrier nursed ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) being barrier nursed)
26 Phototherapy ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving phototherapy)
27 Special monitoring ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving special monitoring of blood glucose or serum bilirubin measurement at a minimum frequency of more than one per calendar day)
28 Observations at regular intervals ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) requiring recorded observations for temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure or scoring for neonatal abstinence syndrome. Recorded observations must be at a minimum frequency of 4 hourly)
29 Intravenous medication ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving intravenous medication)
80 Heated Humidified High Flow Therapy (HHHFT) ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving HHHFT)
81 Presence of an umbilical venous line
82 Continuous infusion of insulin ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving a continuous infusion of insulin)
83 Therapeutic hypothermia ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving therapeutic hypothermia)
84 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has a Replogle tube in situ
85 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has an epidural catheter in situ
86 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has an abdominal silo
87 Administration of intravenous (IV) blood products
88 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has a central venous or long line (Peripherally Inserted Central Catheter line) in situ
89 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has an indwelling urinary or suprapubic catheter in situ
90 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has a trans-anastomotic tube in situ following oesophageal atresia repair
91 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has confirmed clinical seizure(s) today and/or continuous cerebral function monitoring (CFM)
92 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has a ventricular tap via needle or reservoir today
93 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has a stoma

This data is captured and recorded locally and may be used for the purposes of direct care, clinical audit, Reference Costs, and other local uses. Any transmission of the [Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9) must be covered by fair processing arrangements in accordance with information governance criteria and appropriate local arrangements. 

Commissioning Data Set Transmission

Subject to the Commissioning_Data_Set_Version_6-2_XML_Schema_Constraints, the [Neonatal Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c24b7363-c741-4467-a7cc-eb1f813aa8b9) is carried into the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) ([SUS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457)) as a part of the following Commissioning Data Set messages, see SCCI0075:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 120 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|48a8c2fa-a0ce-469d-b72d-e05176cd907e)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 130 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished General Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|03f9bb27-afb1-41c3-b1bd-8bc2ac8dd539)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 180 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6fab2f94-05e8-4d1a-8cc3-1885f056bcc3)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 190 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished General Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|f9efd3d3-bf3b-4012-82ac-a90f9fb140ca) 

The [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) groups this data into neonatal critical care [Healthcare Resource Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced); these are a mandated currency under the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e). Further guidance can be found on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: SCCI0075.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 160 - Admitted Patient Care - Other Delivery Event CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 160 - Admitted Patient Care - Other Delivery Event Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|c28e6545-db5d-406f-9653-33cd0181f0c8) carries the data for an Other Delivery.

This [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) applies to:

  • NHS funded home deliveries and
  • all other delivery events which are not NHS-funded, either directly or under an [NHS SERVICE AGREEMENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|38cc0b58-0a2a-4da6-ad7f-f0347cabcfe1).

The data in these records originates from birth notification records and requires only a limited data set to be completed.

Maternity events, taking place in either NHS hospitals or in non-NHS [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) funded by the NHS, will be recorded using [CDS V6-2 Type 120 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|48a8c2fa-a0ce-469d-b72d-e05176cd907e) and [CDS V6-2 Type 140 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|ad449b19-bd4c-4880-b87e-9afb0d14ca1f).  

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 160 - Admitted Patient Care - Other Delivery Event Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|c28e6545-db5d-406f-9653-33cd0181f0c8) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 100 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Old Service Agreement) CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 100 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Old Service Agreement) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|c4d34350-2dfa-47f2-8ec9-75b0c5be2c15) is used to report to the previous Commissioner that the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) is now the responsibility of a new Commissioner.

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.  

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) are intended for those [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) who have the capability to implement transaction-based processing, and are transmitted using Net Change Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.  They should be supplemented where required by an annual (or other agreed time-cycle) submission of the [CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27). 

Note: for Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e), the [CDS UNIQUE IDENTIFIER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|de0def73-2435-44f4-a825-2e823cc40c88|8e343214-7563-4f1d-aa33-65910b696610), as held in the Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group, must be completed in order to provide the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|503f6c7d-2bca-4744-a546-d60892c2b795) identity.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction. 

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 100 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Old Service Agreement) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|c4d34350-2dfa-47f2-8ec9-75b0c5be2c15) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 002 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Trailer](MC|DM|9705e684-2ff2-41aa-8e5d-b5c887243a52)
One per Interchange submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set
items.description:
Introduction

The purpose of the [Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e) ([DePLCM](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e)) is to enable the interchange, in a uniform format, of monthly [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level device [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) data between all purchasers and [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c). This will ensure that device [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) and reporting is consistent, comparable and fit for purpose across all commissioning [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

The [Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e) is a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level report containing [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) identifiers relating to [High Cost Tariff Excluded Devices](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e8fbc3b6-44b9-4d5b-b120-008483319b19). Its purpose is to substantiate and provide detail to the information contained within the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) ([ACM](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5)).

Scope

The scope of the [Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e) is all NHS-funded [MEDICAL DEVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|0d6a26cb-cd9e-4960-97aa-40b6b06d7837) not reimbursed through the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e), as defined in the [NHS Improvement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bf76952-f1bc-450b-aae4-b1478d3edafc) [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e) High Cost Devices list and any high cost devices not associated with a National Tariff, provided to [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) for all NHS commissioners.

This covers:

  • All acute and community NHS and [Independent Sector Healthcare Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6731416e-8a17-4939-a8ba-152810150e08) secondary [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c), but not primary care, from whom the NHS commissions healthcare;
  • All NHS commissioners ([Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) or their equivalents and [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d)).

Note that the totality of expenditure in the [Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e) must be equivalent to the aggregate monetary value shown relating to [High Cost Tariff Excluded Devices](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e8fbc3b6-44b9-4d5b-b120-008483319b19) in the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5).

Submission

The [Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e) is submitted on a monthly basis to the respective [Data Services for Commissioners Regional Office](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6e84f24b-1f3e-4f4b-8eac-eb02d9d881ec) ([DSCRO](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6e84f24b-1f3e-4f4b-8eac-eb02d9d881ec)) as nominated by each commissioning function in line with the dates documented in the data submission timetable within Schedule 6 of the [NHS Standard Contract](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|519b41dd-a19e-4f8e-90be-7554ed54f492).

The completed monthly [Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e) should be transmitted using the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) [Data Landing Portal](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|06c07147-5469-4af3-b713-c0a5cbbbef0e) ([DLP](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|06c07147-5469-4af3-b713-c0a5cbbbef0e)).

For further information on the [Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e), see the [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) website at: Specialised Services Reporting Requirements.

Access to this version can be obtained by emailing information.standards@nhs.net with "NHS Data Model and Dictionary - Archive Request" in the email subject line.

items.label: Chlamydia Testing Activity Data Set
items.description:
[Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) ([PHE](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6)) is required to monitor and evaluate the [NHS National Chlamydia Screening Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6142e485-c0ca-4efa-b995-b0aa225f1656) ([NCSP](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6142e485-c0ca-4efa-b995-b0aa225f1656)) through the reporting of data.

The [Chlamydia Testing Activity Data Set](MC|DM|c92bee3b-bfea-453a-a4c1-6bb1ec0ada7f) collects information on all chlamydia testing commissioned by the NHS and carried out in all [Laboratory](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) settings in England. It includes results taken from all [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) tested for Chlamydia in all NHS settings, or in non-healthcare settings and as part of the [NHS National Chlamydia Screening Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6142e485-c0ca-4efa-b995-b0aa225f1656) in England.

DATA EXTRACT SPECIFICATION

Description: Each [Laboratory](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8) will be required to generate a quarterly disaggregated data extract of all chlamydia tests carried out using Nucleic Acid Amplification Testing (NAAT).

Time period: The extract will cover one calendar quarter, based on the date the [SAMPLE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|749ee5e9-0c49-4dcc-b209-5dd87d14ac97) is received at the [Laboratory](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3bed1feb-9cda-475c-b9ae-cfee217c07d8).

Frequency: Extracts will run quarterly, 6 weeks after the end of the quarter.

Format: Data returned should be formatted to a comma separated variable (CSV) or MS Excel file.

Transmission: Electronic files will be transmitted to [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) through the secure Microbiology and Epidemiology of STI's and HIV (MESH) Departments web portal. Connection to the portal requires a login account name and password which are available from [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6).

items.label: Critical Care Minimum Data Set
items.description:
The [Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c9d6b338-3823-4c9a-a246-4548a9a647a3) was developed by the Critical Care Information Advisory Group (CCIAG) and endorsed by the Intensive Care Society.

The [Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c9d6b338-3823-4c9a-a246-4548a9a647a3) contains a subset of mandatory items for the generation of Critical Care [Healthcare Resource Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRGs](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)). The Critical Care [HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) subset replaced the Augmented Care Period data elements in the Commissioning Data Sets.

The purpose of the [Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c9d6b338-3823-4c9a-a246-4548a9a647a3) is to provide a standardised set of data to support [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e), [Healthcare Resource Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced), Resource Management, Commissioning and national policy analysis. The full [Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c9d6b338-3823-4c9a-a246-4548a9a647a3) has been incorporated into and is consistent with the ICNARC (Intensive Care National Audit and Research Centre) data collection.

The [Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c9d6b338-3823-4c9a-a246-4548a9a647a3) has been developed to be used in all units where Critical Care is provided. That is where the [CRITICAL CARE LEVEL](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|09a981d8-e09b-4539-a98a-b566fdd76c06|e154b54e-e61f-4927-b797-3023970fd964) is National Code:

  • 02 Patients requiring more detailed observation or intervention including support for a single failing organ system or post-operative care and those 'stepping down' from higher levels of care
or
  • 03 Patients requiring advanced respiratory support alone or monitoring and support for two or more organ systems. This level includes all complex patients requiring support for multi-organ failure.

[Neonates](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3465b0a9-c153-4e95-8f14-10f4ebe185a0) are excluded from the data set. The recording of [Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|c9d6b338-3823-4c9a-a246-4548a9a647a3) for older babies (over 28 days) on Neonatal and Paediatric Intensive Care Units is optional. However, the activity for children treated on adult critical care units should be recorded.
