items.label: National Joint Registry Data Set - Shoulder
items.description:
Background:

The National Joint Registry Data Set collects information on primary [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d) and revision [Joint Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d1c25293-a9b7-49c7-b663-084fa901f74d).

The majority of National Joint Registry Data Set items relate to the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s operation details and are collected in the [OPERATING THEATRE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|42a28a46-7b03-452d-be05-6f647fbb9994|b6def954-671e-435e-93cf-b447d1b9310e).

The National Codes for National Joint Registry items match the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) bulk upload codes / system generated codes.

[PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) must give their consent for this data to be recorded on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) Data Entry System (the electronic system for collection and transfer of data). 

Note: the consent is for data in the 'Patient Identifiers' group. Where consent is not given, the 'Patient Details' group and the operation details are still recorded.

Operations included in the National Joint Registry database:

  • [Primary Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4a69cd6c-786e-4980-8735-dcf86ad64eb7)
  • [Revision Ankle Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f2f87cd5-7b90-47bb-b9ca-7ba60586c425)
  • [Primary Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7804da41-fec7-41a2-89f3-c946a18aac66)
  • [Revision Elbow Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7985d1d9-516c-4be6-9c0a-47806031c91b)
  • [Primary Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|41c4323f-80e5-4b1f-a253-14b75ecb8c8d)
  • [Revision Hip Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|36ba0887-a041-4add-b5b6-5fa914bbfa26)
  • [Primary Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db80b9d1-f233-4e32-a9a5-b2140a7e471a)
  • [Revision Knee Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|266027dd-7765-4754-bbce-1a95eba960ff)
  • [Primary Shoulder Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|144ed8ce-790d-4e09-b14f-933962c2b1fd)
  • [Revision Shoulder Replacement Surgery](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|50c2ddcf-9caf-4b65-b26c-c926b02b5394)

Further Guidance:

Further guidance can be found:

  • For background to the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) on the:
    • [Healthcare Quality Improvement Partnership](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|c9ead133-bb32-441d-b640-ca4b20ca3110) website at: About the NJR
    • [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) website at: Welcome from the National Joint Registry of England, Wales and Northern Ireland

  • Relating to the data set on the [National Joint Registry](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|db27c555-960b-4528-9ca7-4a4dd68a635b) website at: NJR data set.

items.label: Mental Health and Learning Disabilities Data Set
Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set
items.description:
The [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set](MC|DM|cd3ffd7a-96fc-496e-8178-ea218496d1dd) will be in included in a future version of the [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1).

Background:

The [Adult Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5c8377d8-a4b9-4cc1-8190-a5f092066bc9) is an NHS programme in England, which started in 2008, that has transformed treatment of anxiety disorders and depression through the delivery of interventions approved by the [National Institute for Health and Care Excellence](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f79e1b0c-250a-4f67-b706-e4a97ec1a753) ([NICE](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f79e1b0c-250a-4f67-b706-e4a97ec1a753)).

[Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set](MC|DM|cd3ffd7a-96fc-496e-8178-ea218496d1dd)

The [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set](MC|DM|cd3ffd7a-96fc-496e-8178-ea218496d1dd) has been developed to support the [Adult Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5c8377d8-a4b9-4cc1-8190-a5f092066bc9) through a regular national return of data. This includes for example: supporting commissioning, service improvement and service design.

The [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set](MC|DM|cd3ffd7a-96fc-496e-8178-ea218496d1dd) is a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level, output based, secondary uses data set which aims to deliver robust, comprehensive, nationally consistent and comparable information for [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) accessing NHS-funded [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|bcad1481-88da-4f53-967f-5d902d570074) located in England.

As a secondary uses data set, the [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set](MC|DM|cd3ffd7a-96fc-496e-8178-ea218496d1dd) re-uses clinical and operational data for purposes other than direct [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) care. It defines the data items, definitions and associated value sets to be extracted or derived from local information systems. These national definitions allow [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) to extract data from their local systems in a consistent manner, which supports national and local reporting to be undertaken.

The [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set](MC|DM|cd3ffd7a-96fc-496e-8178-ea218496d1dd) includes information on:

  • [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) Demographics: including geographical, gender, age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation and [DISABILITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|c7a7bb14-e036-49d2-8c29-8c91b9af5f68|882beb07-8f68-4e1d-945c-97d9bb7e0ea8)
  • Care Pathways: referral details, Mental Health Care Cluster details and Presenting Complaints information
  • [CARE CONTACTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|e8728c0e-07e7-4b93-af84-dd0825eb7ce3) and [CARE ACTIVITIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|6a735882-3949-462e-9e3e-99536baa857c): [SESSION](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|a9799cb7-3a17-4428-b9aa-ed36538951d0) details and any clinical, economic and social outcomes recorded relating to the interventions and coded scored assessments provided
  • Waiting Time Pauses: [ACTIVITY SUSPENSION](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|5256c70f-3dbb-4e82-afcc-5ffcc366c5f4) periods across the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s care pathway
  • [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Patient Experience Questionnaires](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da2c94a4-efb8-40ed-a69f-d94b399e26d5): Improving Access to Psychological Therapies treatment and assessment questionnaires
  • [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e): Additional data items to support the introduction and development of a payment system for [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|bcad1481-88da-4f53-967f-5d902d570074)
  • [Care Personnel](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|21edf75a-5b9a-4dd9-8926-8d73d9372e22): Qualifications of the [Care Personnel](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|21edf75a-5b9a-4dd9-8926-8d73d9372e22) delivering treatment.

Submission Information:

The [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set](MC|DM|cd3ffd7a-96fc-496e-8178-ea218496d1dd) is submitted centrally on a monthly basis via the [Strategic Data Collection Service in the Cloud](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d9261cc-cdeb-4c6f-a31f-4871ff466944) ([SDCS Cloud](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d9261cc-cdeb-4c6f-a31f-4871ff466944)) maintained by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23).

Further guidance relating to the [Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set](MC|DM|cd3ffd7a-96fc-496e-8178-ea218496d1dd) is available on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website: at Improving Access to Psychological Therapies Data Set.

items.label: CDS V6-1 Type 070 Details
items.description:
This item has been retired from the NHS Data Model and Dictionary.

The last live version of this item is available in the May 2015 release of the NHS Data Model and Dictionary.

Access to this version can be obtained by emailing information.standards@nhs.net with "NHS Data Model and Dictionary - Archive Request" in the email subject line.

items.label: Sexual and Reproductive Health Activity Data Set
items.description:
[Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) requires the mandatory collection of information on the [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) provided by [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23).

The [Sexual and Reproductive Health Activity Data Set](MC|DM|cdb54d3e-20bd-4ecf-b885-c8863e1bc411) provides essential data to:

  • Ensure a relevant collection of electronic data to support local service development
  • Allow monitoring of key policy initiatives and indicators such as: The Public Health Outcome Framework Indicator on under 18 conceptions; increasing access to all methods of contraception, including Long Acting Reversible Contraceptions (LARC) methods and emergency contraception for women of all ages and their partners; reducing teenage conceptions; reducing the rate of unintended pregnancies and modernisation of [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23)
  • Provide appropriate definitions and guidance material to enable a standardised data set from [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23)
  • Support commissioners in understanding which population groups are accessing [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23) and which [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) they are receiving, including the LARC methods as recommended by [National Institute for Health and Care Excellence](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f79e1b0c-250a-4f67-b706-e4a97ec1a753) ([NICE](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|f79e1b0c-250a-4f67-b706-e4a97ec1a753)), and therefore allowing for long-term commissioning of [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135)
  • Develop, over time, indicators of quality and outcome in [SERVICE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) delivery (especially in comparative reports). For example the removal and length of use for LARC devices, provision of emergency [CONTRACEPTION](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|2f7ae079-db9f-4bd6-995c-7ec41f6c555f), the provision of [CONTRACEPTION](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|2f7ae079-db9f-4bd6-995c-7ec41f6c555f) post abortion and referrals to secondary care, the comparison of attendance rates for selected care and the diversity of young [PERSON](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|6bb2bfad-233e-4eb9-ad59-78d6a30544b5) provision by [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23) including social referrals
  • Aid the development of a benchmark measure to indicate how [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) compare in delivering the most appropriate and effective care to [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)
  • Reflect current data collection practices and requirements at [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23).

The [Sexual and Reproductive Health Activity Data Set](MC|DM|cdb54d3e-20bd-4ecf-b885-c8863e1bc411) covers [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) contact with the [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23) whether in a clinic setting, in the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)'s home or at an alternative location.

DATA EXTRACT SPECIFICATION

Description: The [Sexual and Reproductive Health Activity Data Set](MC|DM|cdb54d3e-20bd-4ecf-b885-c8863e1bc411) return includes [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) provided by [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23) in clinics and non-clinic venues (e.g. outreach facilities or domiciliary visits). Also included are [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23) provided by non - NHS clinics funded wholly or in part by [Local Authorities](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9b583b07-94d9-47e4-ab20-9d4b17b87906) and/or [Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) (e.g. Brook). It does not include [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) provided by [CONSULTANTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0) in Outpatient Clinics or those provided by [GENERAL MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|f5ca370c-f7d7-4ff7-8c99-046f592696ad|2948b99a-7255-4041-931c-3b4d63348a45).

Data collected will be used by the NHS, [Care Quality Commission](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d3ac1cf0-a526-418e-9a17-2c6dd96adec4), [Local Authorities](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9b583b07-94d9-47e4-ab20-9d4b17b87906) [Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db), [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) and other appropriate [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) to support the monitoring of the National Strategies on [Sexual and Reproductive Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a0369366-9b54-4890-a278-ce8834a18f23), service provision, benchmarking and development of commissioning.

Time period: The extract will cover one financial year.

Frequency: Extracts run annually, six weeks after the end of the financial year.

Format: Data returned should be formatted to a comma separated variable (CSV) or in a MS Excel file. The data variables should be transmitted in the order specified in the [Sexual and Reproductive Health Activity Data Set](MC|DM|cdb54d3e-20bd-4ecf-b885-c8863e1bc411).

Transmission: Data is submitted via an on-line process to [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23).

For further information on the [Sexual and Reproductive Health Activity Data Set](MC|DM|cdb54d3e-20bd-4ecf-b885-c8863e1bc411) see the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: Sexual and Reproductive Health Activity Data Set (SRHAD) Collection.

items.label: ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST CDS TYPE 100 - EVENT DURING PERIOD (OLD SERVICE AGREEMENT)
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: Diagnostic Imaging Data Set SWK Import Test
items.description:
The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) was introduced by ISB 1577 Diagnostic Imaging Data Set, in response to the lack of detailed data on national data on [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd) tests for NHS [PATIENTS](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|4fdc9622-a107-46b3-94d8-e2aa767026f6|2cf01d35-721d-4cac-a825-90fde3c802d0). The original requirement came from the cancer strategy to improve [GP](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|dbded7aa-f63c-4a16-9bb9-797bb86e2745|26ad1644-23b0-424d-b1e9-8af1547a9dc1) direct access to certain [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd) tests, as a method was required to monitor implementation of this policy.

The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e), however, has many benefits for example, to:

  • Provide NHS data on [GP](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|dbded7aa-f63c-4a16-9bb9-797bb86e2745|26ad1644-23b0-424d-b1e9-8af1547a9dc1)s' direct access to tests, as well as tests requested via other referral sources. Benchmarking data will be fed back to [GP](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|dbded7aa-f63c-4a16-9bb9-797bb86e2745|26ad1644-23b0-424d-b1e9-8af1547a9dc1)s and, where appropriate, used to encourage increased use of tests, leading to earlier diagnosis and hence improved outcomes
  • Provide more detailed NHS data than is currently available on test type (modality), body site of test and [PATIENT](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|4fdc9622-a107-46b3-94d8-e2aa767026f6|2cf01d35-721d-4cac-a825-90fde3c802d0) demographics
  • Enable analysis of turnaround times for tests
  • Enable better analysis of cancer pathways by linking the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|35331d05-4b15-49a8-bb6e-770c85c8ed51) data to [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd) test data for cancer [PATIENTS](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|4fdc9622-a107-46b3-94d8-e2aa767026f6|2cf01d35-721d-4cac-a825-90fde3c802d0)
  • Allow [Public Health England](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|708cef0a-6131-4952-b500-36eeeddd77ae) ([PHE](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|708cef0a-6131-4952-b500-36eeeddd77ae)) to calculate more accurate estimates of the distribution of individual radiation dose estimates from medical exposures.

From April 2012 it became a mandatory requirement that all providers of NHS-funded [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd) tests for NHS [PATIENTS](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|4fdc9622-a107-46b3-94d8-e2aa767026f6|2cf01d35-721d-4cac-a825-90fde3c802d0) in England submit the central [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) on a monthly basis.

The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) facilitates the collection of clinical data and the sharing of such data to underpin the delivery of effective [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd). It is structured around the clinical processes of local Radiology Information Systems (RISs) used by [NHS Trusts](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|aba294ca-6b20-45e2-b9b0-32a9d344d4a7) and [NHS Foundation Trusts](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|580846e4-6308-4164-95a2-5d50f25a3d33). It records administrative data relating to [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd) test [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|b55d8af4-7372-4536-931c-72cee0488de8|4ee84f91-36fb-4f02-8753-939c52f535c3).

Information is collected relating exclusively to [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd) test [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|b55d8af4-7372-4536-931c-72cee0488de8|4ee84f91-36fb-4f02-8753-939c52f535c3). The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) describes [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd) tests that have taken place as part of a broader [PATIENT PATHWAY](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|4fdc9622-a107-46b3-94d8-e2aa767026f6|20d7f7e3-4836-4287-a118-09bb458fb69b). This includes [PATIENTS](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|4fdc9622-a107-46b3-94d8-e2aa767026f6|2cf01d35-721d-4cac-a825-90fde3c802d0) referred from within the [Organisation](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|b70cea05-eef8-4457-acd7-682b525b9b42), either as an out-patient, in-patient or from [Accident and Emergency Departments](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|defd4f49-3cc8-4f02-87c1-425a06d6661d), or referred directly from their [GP](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|dbded7aa-f63c-4a16-9bb9-797bb86e2745|26ad1644-23b0-424d-b1e9-8af1547a9dc1) or another [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|b05a75ed-a366-44e9-9184-f1249c7a04cd).

The [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) is collected from NHS funded providers of [Diagnostic Imaging](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|eb96ee6c-fbdf-4c84-9aa6-23e95c9a84fd) test [SERVICES](MC|DC|6b23c968-c70e-4f85-9419-677e73b90a78|75b9085e-f44d-4635-9e9f-66628a2dbdf7|3e2c7638-fc7f-4c62-bef2-dd0528c7ae43) and submitted via a portal on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|2256fc68-7545-4b63-b1d9-8e3574f33187) website. The submissions are processed and aggregate extracts are produced for provider and commissioner [Organisations](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|b70cea05-eef8-4457-acd7-682b525b9b42) and national groups such as the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|faa40b06-7cf6-45b0-aa9a-dd4e846372a3) and [Public Health England](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|708cef0a-6131-4952-b500-36eeeddd77ae). This also allows linkage to the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|35331d05-4b15-49a8-bb6e-770c85c8ed51).

Please note that the collection of the [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) does not replace any other collection of diagnostic data such as the Diagnostics Waiting Times and Activity Data Set (DM01), which should continue to be collected.

Data Set Order:

  • The transmission order of the [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) is different to the order of the items in the NHS Data Model and Dictionary and XML Schema.
  • Please see the "Guidance Notes" at: Diagnostic Imaging Dataset: Guidance for Data Submitters, which contains a full list of [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) fields in the order they are submitted.
  • Work is planned to amend some of the [Diagnostic Imaging Data Set](MC|DM|7fb56721-2631-40b0-ac27-867610dfb02e) items and when this is approved by the [Data Coordination Board](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|8dd4a4f4-d2ca-44dc-ad18-e09cf9858319) ([DCB](MC|TM|c73ddd69-856f-453b-94ab-3cbd5dcfc4ed|8dd4a4f4-d2ca-44dc-ad18-e09cf9858319)), the NHS Data Model and Dictionary will be updated to match.

items.label: ADMITTED PATIENT CARE CDS TYPE - OTHER BIRTH EVENT
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set
items.description:
The [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) is to enable the interchange, in a uniform and consistent format, of monthly aggregate [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) data between all purchasers and [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c). This will ensure that [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) and reporting is consistent, comparable and fit for purpose across all commissioning [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6).

Submission of the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) is a contractual requirement and a recognised monthly reconciliation statement. It demonstrates the aggregated cost of commissioned clinical care provided to [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) as well as financial adjustments not attributed directly to clinical care. The totality of expenditure documented in the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) must be equivalent to the monetary value of the invoice raised by the [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) and presented to the commissioner.

Scope

The scope of the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) is all NHS-funded clinical care provided (including drugs and [MEDICAL DEVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|0d6a26cb-cd9e-4960-97aa-40b6b06d7837) not covered by the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e)) provided to [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) as well as financial adjustments not attributed directly to clinical care, for all commissioners. This covers:

  • All NHS and [Independent Sector Healthcare Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6731416e-8a17-4939-a8ba-152810150e08), secondary [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c), (acute, mental health and community services), but not primary care, from whom the NHS commissions healthcare.
  • All NHS commissioners ([Clinical Commissioning Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) or their equivalents and [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d))

The [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) is an aggregation of the three separate patient-level [Contract Monitoring](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|eb485af9-665e-4591-b74a-5299aedd248b) data set flows:

  • [Patient Level Contract Monitoring](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5) ([PLCM](MC|DM|786e635b-aad8-41ad-929d-471ed66209d5))
  • [Drugs Patient Level Contract Monitoring](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d) ([DrPLCM](MC|DM|59091657-3d16-4ece-b644-12ca838fca0d))
  • [Devices Patient Level Contract Monitoring](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e) ([DePLCM](MC|DM|c6d7e25c-a3e0-49fa-94a9-6027eb95503e)).

Submission

The [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) is submitted on a monthly basis to the respective [Data Services for Commissioners Regional Office](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6e84f24b-1f3e-4f4b-8eac-eb02d9d881ec) ([DSCRO](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6e84f24b-1f3e-4f4b-8eac-eb02d9d881ec)) as nominated by each commissioning function in line with the dates documented in the data submission timetable within Schedule 6 of the [NHS Standard Contract](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|519b41dd-a19e-4f8e-90be-7554ed54f492).

The completed monthly [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5) should be transmitted using the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) [Data Landing Portal](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|06c07147-5469-4af3-b713-c0a5cbbbef0e) ([DLP](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|06c07147-5469-4af3-b713-c0a5cbbbef0e)).

For further information on the [Aggregate Contract Monitoring Data Set](MC|DM|d43f7631-8154-4223-9696-7ce2759f45e5), see the [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) website at: Specialised Services Reporting Requirements.

items.label: NHS Data Dictionary
items.description:
The NHS Data Model and Dictionary provides a reference point for approved Information Standards and Collections (including Extractions) (ISCEs) to support health care activities within the NHS in England. It has been developed for everyone who is actively involved in the collection of data and the management of information in the NHS.

The NHS Data Model and Dictionary is maintained and published by the NHS Data Model and Dictionary Service and all changes are governed by the Standardisation Committee for Care Information. Changes are published as Information Standards and Collections (including Extractions) Notices (ISCE) and Data Dictionary Change Notices (DDCN).
items.author: NHS Digital

items.label: DARS: Mental Health Minimum Dataset v4 (Sensitive) Records
items.author: Anonymised

items.label: Mental Health Services Data Set
items.description:
Contextual Overview

The [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1) ([null](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1)) is a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) level, output based, secondary uses data set which aims to deliver robust, comprehensive, nationally consistent and comparable person-based information for children, young people and adults (including elderly people) who are in contact with specialist secondary [Mental Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|bbae832a-24b7-48a8-8713-24bf46d01ba2) located in England, or located outside England but treating [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) commissioned by an English [Clinical Commissioning Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) ([CCG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db)) or [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) specialised commissioner.

As a secondary uses data set, the [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1) re-uses clinical and operational data for purposes other than direct [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) care and defines the data items, definitions and associated value sets to be extracted or derived from local information systems.

All [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) relating to [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) who receive specialist secondary [Mental Health Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|bbae832a-24b7-48a8-8713-24bf46d01ba2) and have, or are thought to have:

  • A mental illness
  • A [Learning Disability](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d928bb32-0bd7-41de-8138-1e42fc474623)
  • An [Autistic Spectrum Disorder](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be669c92-fea2-4f1c-aea8-54c8047fde51)
  • Any combination of mental health, [Learning Disability](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d928bb32-0bd7-41de-8138-1e42fc474623) or [Autistic Spectrum Disorder](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be669c92-fea2-4f1c-aea8-54c8047fde51) needs

is within scope of the [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1).

The scope of the [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1) requires [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) record level data submission from [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) as follows:

For each [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) attending a [SERVICE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) located in England:

  • If the care is wholly funded by the NHS: the data submission for that [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) is mandatory
  • If the care is partially funded by the NHS: the data submission for that [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) is mandatory
  • If the care is wholly funded by any means that is not NHS: the data submission for that [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) is optional.

For each [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) attending a [SERVICE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) located outside England, but commissioned by an English [Clinical Commissioning Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d3d730c-59d6-4883-a924-57bf5eef84db) or [NHS England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be5c165b-8f89-4a31-9492-1dd631856d1d) specialised commissioner:

  • The data submission is optional.

The [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1) is used across the range of [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) and [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) that provide specialist secondary mental health and/or [Learning Disabilities](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d928bb32-0bd7-41de-8138-1e42fc474623) and/or [Autistic Spectrum Disorder](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be669c92-fea2-4f1c-aea8-54c8047fde51) [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) (irrespective of funding arrangements) including:

  • NHS Mental Health Trusts
  • NHS Learning Disabilities Trusts
  • NHS Acute Trusts
  • NHS [Care Trusts](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a449693d-5e79-47b5-a4c6-b0e3c14a8447)
  • [Independent Sector Healthcare Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|6731416e-8a17-4939-a8ba-152810150e08) offering a service model that includes NHS funded and non-NHS funded [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9)
  • Any qualified provider offering specialist secondary mental health, [Learning Disability](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|d928bb32-0bd7-41de-8138-1e42fc474623) or [Autistic Spectrum Disorder](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|be669c92-fea2-4f1c-aea8-54c8047fde51) [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135)
  • Community [SERVICES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|589e7a9a-9ef7-47fd-9eb5-27c1cd4cb4f4|99d407a3-8e4b-4f8c-8f0b-30c26624f135) offering secondary care to children.

Submission information

The [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1) is submitted centrally via the [Strategic Data Collection Service in the Cloud](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d9261cc-cdeb-4c6f-a31f-4871ff466944) ([SDCS Cloud](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|8d9261cc-cdeb-4c6f-a31f-4871ff466944)) maintained by [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23).

The [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1) has historically been submitted using two submission windows, primary and refresh. This has changed to a multiple submission window model which gives submitters the opportunity to resubmit throughout the submission year. Guidance on the new submission model can be found on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: How to submit to the MHSDS.

Further guidance

Further information regarding the structure and submission of the [Mental Health Services Data Set](MC|DM|d5a5ea2e-6de5-4b15-bea4-e92f1c2908a1) can be found on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: Mental Health Services Data Set (MHSDS).

items.label: CDS INTERCHANGE HEADER
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 010 - Accident and Emergency CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 010 - Accident and Emergency Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|d6687ddd-5e87-4fe3-bbb9-afb8ff1c6847) carries the data for an [Accident and Emergency Attendance](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|4aaac7a4-d792-42af-827d-def398b51345).

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 010 - Accident and Emergency Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|d6687ddd-5e87-4fe3-bbb9-afb8ff1c6847) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2 TYPE 010 - ACCIDENT AND EMERGENCY COMMISSIONING DATA SET
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To support the details of an Accident and Emergency Attendance.

M 1..1 DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|ebf9db2f-875b-4a5f-b32a-0fa27d3bfa93)
One per Interchange submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.
M 1..* DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|88da6818-57e9-445c-b1ca-df24ae511cf1)
One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
M 1..1 DATA GROUP: COMMISSIONING DATA SET TRANSACTION HEADER GROUP
Dependent upon the Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol being used, one of the following must be used per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457):
[CDS V6-2 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|08041212-bd87-459b-a1ed-f68488bca030)
Or
[CDS V6-2 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|1879991f-da27-4e15-b097-43745796fcf0)

O 0..1 DATA GROUP: PATIENT PATHWAY

R 0..1 DATA GROUP: PERSON GROUP (A AND E CONSULTANT)

R 0..1 DATA GROUP: CLINICAL DIAGNOSIS GROUP (A AND E)
R 0..1 DATA GROUP: CLINICAL INVESTIGATION GROUP (A AND E)
O 0..1 DATA GROUP: CLINICAL ACTIVITY GROUP (OPCS)
O 0..1 DATA GROUP: CLINICAL ACTIVITY GROUP (READ)
R 0..1 DATA GROUP: CLINICAL TREATMENT GROUP (A AND E)

M 1..* DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|a5c4a6a0-ed3b-4a2a-b97b-694ecbd3e617)
One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.

items.label: Radiotherapy Data Set
items.description:
Background

[Radiotherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3b1e96ec-7a3a-4e48-8a08-2427a9a2bbed) is a major modality in the treatment of cancer and also represents a significant sector within the NHS, in terms of both workforce and capital investment.

The [Radiotherapy Data Set](MC|DM|d9d4bb04-a49d-487d-9966-3e6300001497) ([RTDS](MC|DM|d9d4bb04-a49d-487d-9966-3e6300001497)) allows for the routine collection of clinically and managerially relevant [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) data from [Radiotherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3b1e96ec-7a3a-4e48-8a08-2427a9a2bbed) facilities, in order to commission or monitor [Radiotherapy Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|520fa6ea-9d39-413c-b5a8-e84acd3b1752) in an evidence-based manner.

All NHS funded facilities in England providing [Radiotherapy Services](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|520fa6ea-9d39-413c-b5a8-e84acd3b1752) are required to return data to [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) ([PHE](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6)) for all [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) undertaken on [Teletherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51276b55-e2d0-4267-9a1d-8afb1b90a012) and [Brachytherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|2c1daa18-d8fe-412d-a245-3b0d0d0e6d15) [MACHINES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|0467fe63-5a7c-46ac-989b-65a805f02097), or with radioisotopes not contained within a [Teletherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|51276b55-e2d0-4267-9a1d-8afb1b90a012) or [Brachytherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|2c1daa18-d8fe-412d-a245-3b0d0d0e6d15) [MACHINE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|0467fe63-5a7c-46ac-989b-65a805f02097).

The [Radiotherapy Data Set](MC|DM|d9d4bb04-a49d-487d-9966-3e6300001497) accompanies the Out-Patient Commissioning Data Set for [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) attending for [Radiotherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3b1e96ec-7a3a-4e48-8a08-2427a9a2bbed).

Where in-patients attend for [Radiotherapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3b1e96ec-7a3a-4e48-8a08-2427a9a2bbed), a [Radiotherapy Attendance](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|239441a1-90a4-447d-b5d3-810002ea8591) record should be submitted to [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) along with the Out-Patient Commissioning Data Set for the In-Patient Attendance.

For further guidance, see the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) website at: National Radiotherapy Data Set (RTDS).

Data Submission

The [Radiotherapy Data Set](MC|DM|d9d4bb04-a49d-487d-9966-3e6300001497) should be submitted to [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) by the 15th working day of each month. The extracts should include all [Radiotherapy Attendance](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|239441a1-90a4-447d-b5d3-810002ea8591) records for the previous calendar month.

The [Radiotherapy Data Set](MC|DM|d9d4bb04-a49d-487d-9966-3e6300001497) should be submitted in the approved format and accompanied by the Out-Patient Commissioning Data Set.

Data should be submitted using the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) ([NCRAS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c)) upload portal on the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) website at: National Radiotherapy Data Set (RTDS).

Further Guidance

Further guidance for submission of the [Radiotherapy Data Set](MC|DM|d9d4bb04-a49d-487d-9966-3e6300001497) is provided by the [National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|79b3492e-6eb8-4659-883a-a1ff5000033c) at: National Radiotherapy Data Set (RTDS).

items.label: Paediatric Critical Care Minimum Data Set
items.description:
Introduction

The [Paediatric Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|db3c84b6-a371-45da-93bd-9de515aa0b69) ([PCCMDS](MC|DM|db3c84b6-a371-45da-93bd-9de515aa0b69)) provides a record of what happens to a [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) when they receive Paediatric Critical Care in a Paediatric Intensive Care Unit, or other critical care setting suitable for children.

The primary purpose of the [Paediatric Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|db3c84b6-a371-45da-93bd-9de515aa0b69) is to allow the operation of the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e) within paediatric critical care. The [Paediatric Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|db3c84b6-a371-45da-93bd-9de515aa0b69) supports the [National Tariff Payment System](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|fff89db6-d20c-4ba1-a112-4c61d1d8fe1e) by capturing the data needed to generate a [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) for each calendar day (or part thereof) of a period of paediatric critical care; these [Healthcare Resource Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) are then used to inform the annual aggregate costing exercise, NHS Reference Costs.

Scope and Uses

The scope of the [Paediatric Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|db3c84b6-a371-45da-93bd-9de515aa0b69) is:

a) All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) on a [WARD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ddbf9ee6-2fcd-4b2b-b073-16c0514bc527|8b80e7fc-0349-4ce4-836c-50bd712d51ac) with a [CRITICAL CARE UNIT FUNCTION](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|09a981d8-e09b-4539-a98a-b566fdd76c06|72e9c498-36b6-4c0c-9ca6-fcb191881170) of National Code '04 - Paediatric Intensive Care Unit (Paediatric critical care patients predominate)'

b) All [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) on a [WARD](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|ddbf9ee6-2fcd-4b2b-b073-16c0514bc527|8b80e7fc-0349-4ce4-836c-50bd712d51ac) with a [CRITICAL CARE UNIT FUNCTION](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|09a981d8-e09b-4539-a98a-b566fdd76c06|72e9c498-36b6-4c0c-9ca6-fcb191881170) of National Code of either:

  • 16 - Ward for children and young people
  • 17 - High Dependency Unit for children and young people
  • 18 - Renal Unit for children and young people
  • 19 - Burns Unit for children and young people
  • 92 - Non standard location using the operating department for children and young people

to whom one or more of the following [CRITICAL CARE ACTIVITY CODES](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|09a981d8-e09b-4539-a98a-b566fdd76c06|3b6afa7e-9744-49ea-b40c-5cc033aa61f7) applies for a period greater than 4 hours: 

04 Exchange Transfusion ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) received exchange transfusion)
05 Peritoneal dialysis (acute [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) only i.e. excluding chronic) *
06 Continuous infusion of inotrope, pulmonary vasodilator or prostaglandin ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) received a continuous infusion of an inotrope, vasodilator (includes pulmonary vasodilators) or prostaglandin)
09 [Oxygen Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9d0737bf-b6fd-4a5f-bb89-eac1f0234e65) (supplementary [Oxygen Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9d0737bf-b6fd-4a5f-bb89-eac1f0234e65), irrespective of ventilatory state) **
13 Tracheostomy cared for by nursing staff ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving care of tracheostomy cared for by nursing staff not by an external [Carer](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|e0ad12cd-4cd0-4c85-a0d4-4ec419afd7e7) (e.g. parent))
16 Haemofiltration ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) received Haemofiltration)
50 Continuous electrocardiogram monitoring
51 Invasive ventilation via endotracheal tube
52 Invasive ventilation via tracheostomy tube
53 Non-invasive ventilatory support
55 Nasopharyngeal airway
56 Advanced ventilatory support (Jet or Oscillatory ventilation)
57 Upper airway obstruction requiring nebulised Epinephrine/ Adrenaline
58 Apnoea requiring intervention
59 Acute severe asthma requiring intravenous bronchodilator therapy or continuous nebuliser
60 Arterial line monitoring
61 Cardiac pacing via an external box (pacing wires or external pads or oesophageal pacing)
62 Central venous pressure monitoring
63 Bolus intravenous fluids (> 80 ml/kg/day) in addition to maintenance intravenous fluids
64 Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation (CPR)
65 Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or Ventricular Assist Device (VAD) or aortic balloon pump
66 Haemodialysis (acute [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) only i.e. excluding chronic)
67 Plasma filtration or Plasma exchange
68 ICP-intracranial pressure monitoring
69 Intraventricular catheter or external ventricular drain
70 Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) requiring continuous infusion of insulin
71 Intravenous infusion of thrombolytic agent (limited to tissue plasminogen activator [tPA] and streptokinase)
72 Extracorporeal liver support using Molecular Absorbent Liver Recirculating System (MARS)
73 Continuous pulse oximetry
74 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) nursed in single occupancy cubicle
80 Heated Humidified High Flow Therapy (HHHFT) ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving HHHFT)
85 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has an epidural catheter in situ
94 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has arrhythmia requiring intravenous anti-arrhythmic therapy
95 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has reduced conscious level (Glasgow Coma Score 12 or below) and hourly (or more frequent) Glasgow Coma Score monitoring
96 Intravenous infusion of sedative agent ([PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receiving continuous intravenous infusion of sedative agent)
97 [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) has status epilepticus requiring treatment with continuous intravenous infusion

Notes:

  • * National Code 05 applies as an inclusion criterion for acute [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) only: it does not apply with chronic [PATIENTS](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9).
  • ** National Code 09 applies as an inclusion criterion when the [PATIENT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|d5142beb-589f-4aff-ae5d-026a70fba24a|3716850b-1e4b-4798-947a-846586764fd9) receives supplementary [Oxygen Therapy](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9d0737bf-b6fd-4a5f-bb89-eac1f0234e65), irrespective of their ventilatory state.

This data is captured and recorded locally and may be used for the purposes of direct care, clinical audit, Reference Costs, and other local uses. Any transmission of the [Paediatric Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|db3c84b6-a371-45da-93bd-9de515aa0b69) must be covered by fair processing arrangements in accordance with information governance criteria and appropriate local arrangements.

Commissioning Data Set Transmission

Subject to the Commissioning_Data_Set_Version_6-2_XML_Schema_Constraints, the [Paediatric Critical Care Minimum Data Set](MC|DM|db3c84b6-a371-45da-93bd-9de515aa0b69) is sent to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) ([SUS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457)) as a part of the following Commissioning Data Set messages, SCCI0076:

  • [CDS V6-2 Type 120 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|48a8c2fa-a0ce-469d-b72d-e05176cd907e)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 130 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished General Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|03f9bb27-afb1-41c3-b1bd-8bc2ac8dd539)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 140 - Admitted Patient Care - Finished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|ad449b19-bd4c-4880-b87e-9afb0d14ca1f)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 180 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Birth Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|6fab2f94-05e8-4d1a-8cc3-1885f056bcc3)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 190 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished General Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|f9efd3d3-bf3b-4012-82ac-a90f9fb140ca)
  • [CDS V6-2 Type 200 - Admitted Patient Care - Unfinished Delivery Episode Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|834b764b-236f-4087-a2fd-dccbfbdb9f38)

The [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) groups this data into paediatric critical care [Healthcare Resource Groups](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced). Further guidance can be found on the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) website at: SCCI0076.

items.label: CDS TRANSACTION HEADER GROUP BULK UPDATE
items.description:
The Commissioning Data Sets (null) are maintained and developed by the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23), in accordance with the needs of the NHS and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12).

Commissioning Data Sets form the basis of data on [ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) carried out by [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) reported centrally for monitoring and payment purposes. They support the current [Healthcare Resource Group](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced) ([HRG](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|da345d65-75b6-4ea6-bfda-5a584e93aced)) version for calculation of payment to trusts and monitoring of other initiatives.

Requests for changes to the Commissioning Data Sets should be submitted via email to enquiries@nhsdigital.nhs.uk, stating "Commissioning Data Sets" in the subject line.

Current versions of the Commissioning Data Sets can be found at Commissioning_Data_Set_Versions.

For further information on Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Overview.

items.label: Cover of Vaccination Evaluated Rapidly (COVER) Data Set
items.description:
The [Cover of Vaccination Evaluated Rapidly (COVER) Data Set](MC|DM|dd008952-4074-4fab-8e1b-1003073c3b2f) is used to evaluate the routine childhood [Immunisation Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|86279e5f-d533-4d9c-a84f-d21aace70c5b) in England for children up to 5 years of age. The aim is to collect and report vaccine uptake data for all children at one, two and five years of age on a quarterly and annual basis.

The [Cover of Vaccination Evaluated Rapidly (COVER) Data Set](MC|DM|dd008952-4074-4fab-8e1b-1003073c3b2f) is also used to evaluate the neonatal hepatitis B [Immunisation Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|86279e5f-d533-4d9c-a84f-d21aace70c5b) in England for babies born to hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) positive mothers.

The information is used:

  • to reliably measure vaccine coverage
  • to evaluate the success of a vaccination programme
  • to identify susceptible populations for further interventions
  • and to inform future vaccine policy decisions.
[Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) is mandated to report on vaccine uptake figures for children aged one, two and five years for the [Local Authority](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|9b583b07-94d9-47e4-ab20-9d4b17b87906) (upper tier) resident population for the Public Health Outcomes Framework (PHOF) indicator 3.03 Population vaccination coverage.

[NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) is mandated to produce the annual [Cover of Vaccination Evaluated Rapidly (COVER)](MC|DM|dd008952-4074-4fab-8e1b-1003073c3b2f) statistics. [Cover of Vaccination Evaluated Rapidly (COVER)](MC|DM|dd008952-4074-4fab-8e1b-1003073c3b2f) statistics enable the monitoring of the contribution of the routine childhood [Immunisation Programme](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|86279e5f-d533-4d9c-a84f-d21aace70c5b) towards protecting and improving the nations health and are used to address inequalities.

[Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) and the [Department of Health and Social Care](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|40b0b0e5-ee96-4b33-befe-2676c9ec2f12) also have commitments to report vaccine coverage figures to international organisations such as the [World Health Organisation](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5a94007a-2fe6-421f-a8df-3844c8aa114d), and the [European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|0fcd2c39-9dea-449f-b0e9-7df93b22311a).

Submission

Immunisation records are held in Child Health Information Systems (CHIS). Quarterly and annual returns are transmitted by Child Health Record Departments (who operate local Child Health Information Systems (CHIS)) or other local [Health Care Providers](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c) to the [NHS Digital](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|3e342b04-b5eb-43c4-8e37-101d52852b23) [Strategic Data Collection Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|77f0392c-a996-41d1-b528-3d8d56a18408) ([SDCS](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|77f0392c-a996-41d1-b528-3d8d56a18408)).

Further Guidance

For further guidance see the [Public Health England](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|141d88ba-1785-4f5b-a3ea-141f469ca9a6) part of the gov.uk website at Vaccine uptake guidance and the latest coverage data.

items.label: CDS V6-2 Type 060 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Add) CDS
items.description:
[CDS V6-2 Type 060 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Add) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|ea3b8fd4-6e2a-4232-b967-ca556f08514a) is used to make an initial report that an [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) has been added to the [Health Care Provider](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|28247805-b87f-48d1-bbc1-38c676449a4c)'s [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|503f6c7d-2bca-4744-a546-d60892c2b795).

It covers [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST ENTRIES](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|1e24e4c6-bb45-49da-9e4d-bde7fadebe58) under the care of a [CONSULTANT](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|549020d3-7ad2-422d-9bf4-a17361000c7d|9035ab3e-dc67-41b8-80f9-dd80c16689f0), [MIDWIFE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|60380df3-ee78-4771-b905-048bd6777c9f|8a80f236-e42b-4cdc-a156-c292af21ccec) or [NURSE](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|9f876480-8592-4072-91e4-bb1bdd177395|25413d1a-0ca5-4fc1-8001-f7913a89d518), where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists.

[ACTIVITY](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|3db88d80-ce3f-484a-a8e2-8e8928f07bab|e6ce3f35-ecba-47cb-83ca-f7c886f9d4ff) taking place under the care of Allied Health Professionals, other [Biomedical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|12afce55-ed87-43e9-a55a-04339b380af4) and [Clinical Scientists](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5585821a-0e22-4c7b-b20d-5ce90fb844d9) may also be carried (where an appropriate [MAIN SPECIALTY CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|39964545-f892-4be9-bbb5-0ab70bb3ef9f|3ff38bf2-14c5-4584-ae54-ac0ffc4a0dbe) and [TREATMENT FUNCTION CODE](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|01d10655-7dde-4ddb-97a4-98237a43502c|d456ef8c-c545-4a6c-bd66-31e4b171deaf) exists) if required although this is not a Commissioning Data Set Mandated Data Flow.

Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) are intended for those [Organisations](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|5bc85266-6f29-421b-9954-5fcd680dbae6) who have the capability to implement transaction-based processing, and are transmitted using Net Change Commissioning Data Set Submission Protocol.  They should be supplemented where required by an annual (or other agreed time-cycle) submission of the [CDS V6-2 Type 030 - Elective Admission List - End of Period Census (Standard) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|30379087-0155-46c7-905a-d133d5cb1d27). 
 

Where the Care Activity data relates to a [Referral To Treatment Period Included In Referral To Treatment Consultant-Led Waiting Times Measurement](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|a9f64c7f-96ee-48f1-8199-cb614334d8de), the CDS DATA GROUP : PATIENT PATHWAY data elements must be completed where appropriate.

Note: for Elective Admission List Event During Period [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e), the [CDS UNIQUE IDENTIFIER](MC|DE|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|de0def73-2435-44f4-a825-2e823cc40c88|8e343214-7563-4f1d-aa33-65910b696610), as held in the Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group, must be completed in order to provide the [ELECTIVE ADMISSION LIST](MC|DC|3a64e05a-6aa6-45a7-944f-564d8975920f|1669046f-6505-4142-8ce8-355744a62f3f|503f6c7d-2bca-4744-a546-d60892c2b795) identity.

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2 Type 060 - Elective Admission List - Event During Period (Add) Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|ea3b8fd4-6e2a-4232-b967-ca556f08514a) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

items.label: CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - CDS Message Header
items.description:
The [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458) carries mandatory controls for a Commissioning Data Set Message and is only used by inclusion in other [CDS Types](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e).

Note that the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458) should only be used when submitting the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 011 - Emergency Care Commissioning Data Set](MC|DM|bcd3b1f8-c6c0-4747-9ed1-8ecaddcb6b34).

Commissioning Data Set Interchanges containing Commissioning Data Set Messages submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457) must use the required Commissioning Data Set Interchange and Message Header and Trailer Controls to provide the correct addressing and identification for the data flows.

Multiple Commissioning Data Set messages are usually sent in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange which consists of:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 001 - Commissioning Data Set Interchange Header](MC|DM|81a9a1eb-5da6-4cd8-bd43-117da26457d3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Interchange
  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

Dependent upon the Commissioning_Data_Set_Submission_Protocol being used, one of the following must be used:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005B - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Bulk Update Protocol](MC|DM|524d6d85-1332-41f7-8787-ee2ab7e4bc60) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)
  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 005N - Commissioning Data Set Transaction Header Group - Net Change Protocol](MC|DM|72005e06-29c3-4baa-a36f-3bf926b45ea6) - Mandatory, one per [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e)

Followed by:

  • The [CDS Type](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|7ec498e6-9673-4658-b70f-87442b47291e) - As required to carry the specific Commissioning Data Set data records

Each Commissioning Data Set message ends with:

  • [CDS V6-2-1 Type 004 - Commissioning Data Set Message Trailer](MC|DM|0ca039a8-450a-4343-ac86-bf443239bad3) - Mandatory - One per Commissioning Data Set Message

To access more detailed information on the Commissioning Data Sets, see the Commissioning_Data_Sets_Introduction.

Data Group Overview

A high-level view of the Data Groups carried in the [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458) is shown below.

See Commissioning Data Set Notation for an explanation of Group Status and Group Repeats.

Notation DATA GROUP OVERVIEW: CDS V6-2-1 TYPE 003 - CDS MESSAGE HEADER
Group
Status 		Group
Repeats 		FUNCTION:
To define the mandatory identity and addressing information for a Commissioning Data Set submission .
M 1..* DATA GROUP: [CDS V6-2-1 Type 003 - Commissioning Data Set Message Header](MC|DM|ea69d2cb-a601-41fc-8192-c9fa65151458)
One per Commissioning Data Set Message submitted to the [Secondary Uses Service](MC|TM|be96ac9d-c9c4-4043-86aa-9215c8c84e71|cc7e0df3-d04b-47ef-9d8d-e42a7f697457).
Multiple Commissioning Data Set Messages may be submitted in a single Commissioning Data Set Interchange.
